Update 7/11/2014: After doing a clean install of another ROM I noticed immediately the wireless charging issues I was experiencing disappeared. It is very responsive now, even with the DualPro case on, so this has led me to believe the issues were being caused by a bug on the phone's end. Do not let this review deter you from buying this charger; it is fantastic!I went with this over the RAV power charger based on another person's recommendation, even though at the time of this review they are currently the same price. I was looking for a charging pad strong enough to charge the phone through my Incipio DualPro Case for the LG G2 (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F4B1DRO/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_2) but unfortunately this one doesn't cut it, even with the 3 coils and the 2 amp wall adapter I'm using.When I place the phone on the pad with the case on, there is a delayed reaction to the charging indicator and the charging pad LED blinks (which means it doesn't recognize what's been placed on it. But if I take the outer plastic shell off the phone and leave the rubber on it, it charges just fine. I'm not getting accurate readings on how fast it charges though, because my phone is rooted and have been experiencing issues with battery accuracy, as well as in other places. So I can't comment on that. However I am very happy with it, I like that the phone doesn't have to sit in a very specific spot for it to work. I honestly don't feel it's worth $32 though, but that could be because I'm a cheapskate lol. I would happily pay $20 or $25 for this.

It fits my 1020 in a Tudia case perfectly. Much better qualilty than 1020 vertical case with red stitches that I had to trash as it destroyed my yellow Tudia case; purchased black one to replace it just in case even though my phone is yellow. Yellow 1020 looks good actually in a black Tudia case.

They work perfectly! I was worried about how long they would stick but I placed one on my phone and it feels very secure. It works wonderfully and I really like how it feels raised and I feel it enhances the home button.

This case has a nice look and feel to it, it doesn't seem to interfere with any of the moving parts, and has little rubber covers for buttons and ports.  Very nice.  Seems sturdy enough that it should absorb a lot of damage if the phone is dropped.  So far very happy with it. (Note: this was a gift to someone, and this is what they told me.  Based on their input, and my seeing it myself, I will probably get one for me too.)

So, I already got a protective screen protection film and wanted a good grip case where I can use it with one hand and know that it won't fall out of my hands easily.This is the case.  I love it.  I love the feel of it.  I love the look of it.  Not too crazy, not to colorful and it sits nicely on any flat surface.  The rubber is soft enough to take off without too much hassle but hard enough that it protects it from minor drops.I would get this case instead of the other $30 or $40 dollar ones with terrible shipping and long waits. The case fits my Motorola Triumph very snugly, with holes cut correctly for all buttons and ports. The surface has a tacky rubberized coating that prevents slips. However, the black coating does not cover the seam where the two pieces touch, so there's an uneven white line that runs along the edge of the phone.  This makes the phone looks cheap.The case made my phone more bulky, which is quite understandable.  The problem is that it doesn't fit my car phone mount anymore, so I have to buy a new one.  I didn't deduct a star for this problem though, but you should think about it before you buy.
summary: Fits well.  White line around edge.

This cable has worked well in my car, connecting my Samsung Note II smartphone to various USB chargers.  Not only is it more compact than the standard 6 ft cable, it has similarly precise connectors as the OEM cable - unlike other inexpensive cables.  In the past, I have experienced damage to mobile phones when using really inexpensive cables of dubious origin. Hence, I generally would never purchase a dock or cable before reading verified reviews.One other point to note about the length is that 2.5 feet is both short enough to cleanly mount a phone on the dash while long enough to use the phone in a conventional manner while seated in driver's position.  Basically, you get the best of both worlds.
summary: Great for in-vehicle use, precise connectors

Review ofNew Trent (1PC) Limir Dual Purpose Stylus/Styli for Capacitive Touch Screen Smartphones and Tablets. 2-in-1: Stylus (Micro-Knit Tip) and Fine Ball PenStylus: pros: It has a very smart color combination, nice size and seem fairly sturdy (other then the clip attachment). It handy to have a pen on the other end; the pen writes very smoothly with little smudging and is easy to handle. The stylus end is soft and should not scratch the screen.Cons: The mesh on the stylus seems to attract some lint from things in the environment (clothing, furniture, etc.) it has only done this a little so far, but it has just been in use for 5 days. It works fairly well for surfing the web or opening and closing files, but does not work as well for games. On solitaire, FreeCell, etc. sometimes one tap is registered as two. On things like angry birds it works less well. Example, bird is released from sling shot before stylus is pulled off the tablet. For fine things such as this your finger works better. I use it on my nook hd+ tablet. This might be just the ticket for a smaller screen where there is little room to swipe your finger. I opened up the pen part to check out ink cartridge (for future replacement) and the clip on the side popped out. I was able to reattach it. The ink cartridge has no printing on it, so it will be hard to know what to replace it with.Room for improvement: have a retractable stylus or a cap to protect the end when not in use. Labeling on ink cartridge to make it easier to replace. Attach clip to the side more firmly. Maybe if there was not as much give on the mesh end it would not be so sensitive? I would rate it 4 out of five stars. Please see attached picture.update: 4/23  some ink is globing on the end.
summary: Both a pen and a stylus

I am an owner of a Republic Wireless MotoX.  It's only my second ever smartphone, but it far exceeds my previous Defy XT.  Since upgrading, I have noticed an incredibly responsive Ice Cream Sandwich Android OS, superb voice recognition using Google's "ok, google, now" feature, 90% responsiveness using NFC tags, and 100% responsiveness to the "twist twice" camera shortcut. And at such a cheap price (only $200 if you go through Republic Wireless), there's no going wrong.  The battery life is very decent, but I wil admit it's annoying that if I am using maps AND listening to Pandora while driving AND charging the phone using my car charger, the phone will still ultimately discharge.  The GPS and data and bluetooth all on at the same time are too much for it to charge.  After doing this for about 2 hours, the phone will die.  So I guess more battery life is to be desired, but I personally would not sacrifice it's incredibly smooth and sleek form factor for this extended battery life.  I'd much rather get a case that doubles as a battery, which still as of March 2014 does not exist for some reason.  I will not ding the phone for battery life, as it is leaps and bounds better than my old Defy XT.I love the NFC, too.  Combined with the application "trigger", I can create actions that respond to various NFC tags, with seemingly endless options/combinations.  I highly recommend this phone as I have used it daily for 6 months now, and have not had ANY issues.  Not once have I needed to reboot due to unresponsiveness or freezing, which was a daily occurrence with my old Defy.

These are very good batteries and give a little more operating time than the original Samsung. However, they are not the original size. They are ever so slightly thicker and the back cover is harder to reinstall.  It also leaves a slight bump on the back cover at the battery corner.  One of my slim cases would no longer fit the phone. The customer service was great and handled my concerns quickly.  I like the charger too, but I don't like the color.  I don't know about that fastest charger in the world thing, but it is not the slowest either. The battery does hang over the edge of the charger which seems strange to me.  Overall, if you want a little more operating time, don't use NFC, and don't care if the back has a bump (most cases will hide this), then this is the battery set I recommend.

This is the first problem to attend to when your charger doesn't work properly. Price is great, but the more of them you add to your cart the shipping will increase. The deal is still a steal.

I literally collect external batteries. If I see a reasonably good one on sale, I will buy it. I purchased this one on sale after reading the reviews.And after a bit of testing, it has become my favorite.Yes, it is heavier than lower-capacity external batteries. This is a given: you don't get the reserve energy without adding cells and thus weight. If you are very weight sensitive (i.e. wilderness backpacking, carrying it in a fanny pack at Disneyworld all day,etc.), then look for a lower capacity product. What really appeals to me is being able to use this with newer internally charging digital cameras.The design is simplistic and that's a compliment. The LCD display is an act of brilliance. Much better than the diode system used in so many others.The inclusion of micro-USB, 30-pin and Lightning Apple adapters is a definite plus.I've only tried recharging a couple of devices and everything worked well.The product was delivered with a 55% charge and bringing it to 100% took about 8 hours. Nothing spectacular here, one way or the other.Time will tell, of course, as to the durability of the unit, its actual storage capacity and so on. But right now it is very, very impressive and if I see it on sale again, I will snatch up another or two as gifts.If  you travel with an array of rechargeable gadgetry, this looks to b a great unit. If my opinion changes, I will amend my review.Jerry
summary: Heavier than lower capacity external batteries, but the extra power capacity is worth it.

reviewText: I don't understand why so many people are complaining about the firmware. The phone had no problems at all from the beginning when I got the device.I did update the firmware two times (one for each time a firmware was released) and I don't notice any improvements either.Well, based on my experience with the Nokia E90, Touch Pro2, HTC HD2, Apple iPhone 3G, Sony Ericsson Xperia X1, and the Nokia N95, I really think this is the best phone out of all of them.1) Build Quality - The build is alright. There are no wobbly parts (not even the battery cover which people complain about). There is some light leakage on the the upper 'functionality' keys and it is distracting. All Nokia E72's have light leakage here. The Micro SD and USB covers are easily damaged, so you need to be careful when you pry them open. I have not broken these but I can tell that they can snap off easily. But in the end, the build quality on the E72 is very nice and sturdy. The screen also comes with a pre-installed screen protector that can be pealed off.2) Efficiency - This phone does not disappoint in making yourself more productive. The phone is very fast compared to Nokia N95, Nokia E90, and Xperia X1. The back-lighting on the QWERTY keyboard has the perfect brightness. It is much brighter than the Nokia E90's dim keyboard. Because the keyboard lacks a number row and needs larger keys, the Nokia E90 or Touch Pro2 is a better choice if you really need a really good keyboard. However, I was willing to sacrifice the awesome Nokia E90 keyboard to compromise for E72's better features and not-so-bad keyboard. From best to worst, here is how I rank between different keyboards: HTC Touch Pro2 > Nokia E90 > Nokia E72 > HTC HD2 > Apple iPhone > Xperia X1. You will never accidentally turn on your phone and dial numbers when you leave the E72 in your pocket. The phone will never unlock in your pocket (as long as you manually or automatically lock the screen).Most importantly, the Nokia E72 has a better keyboard and better buttons than the E71. There really only is one thing about the E71 keys that are better than the E72 keys. Since the E72 has a mushy optical sensor, using the D-pad isn't fun. The Nokia E71 has a better D-pad (it's more clicky and less mushy). However, the E71 'functionality' buttons are very cramped. I find it two times more efficient pressing the Menu/Calendar/Contacts/Messaging button on the E72 because the buttons are larger and raised. Even the surrounding buttons work well. On the E71 I would press multiple buttons at once. This problem rarely happens on the E72. In terms of the QWERTY keys, the E72 and E71 are very similar. However, the number and Ctrl key on the E72 is larger by comparison. So the E72 wins in terms of keyboard and buttons.3) Battery Efficiency - The brand new battery on the E72 lasts much longer than the all of the phones I've had and used. Furthermore, it is easy to remove and replace, unlike the Nokia E90 and Xperia X1.4) Camera - The camera isn't that good. I still haven't found a phone with a camera that's worth using. From what I can see, I don't think their is much difference between Nokia E72 and Xperia X1's camera. However, the LED flash on the E72 is the pretty good compared to other phone. Of course, I haven't used the camera that much and I am not a camera pro so you can't rely on me in this area.5) Multimedia - the mono speaker on the back of the phone isn't very loud, but it isn't very quiet. It's much louder than the iPhone at max level but much softer than the Nokia E90 (which has amazing stereo speakers). The music player is great, and thanks to the keyboard, I can search through my music library without scrolling. Furthermore, the audio processing on this phone is on par to my laptop. I hear no difference in sound quality between my laptop and my E72 when I use the same headphones. Watching videos on the low-resolution phone is pretty decent and even clear, but because all Nokia comes with a terrible video player, I am disappointed. But thanks to how well a 600 qualcomm CPU performs on Symbian phones, multimedia is very breezy.6) Phone and Organizer - this is an Eseries Nokia device running on symbian. Most Eseries organizer and phone software are same or similar. Well, in my opinion, the Eseries software is better than Windows Mobile and iPhone. Of course one of the main problem with contacts, calendars, and notes on non-touchscreen Nokia's is that you need a good keyboard to be well organized. Well the E72 has a decent keyboard.But in regards other than software, the loudspeaker/speakerphone is very low so conversations will be annoying because it's hard to hear when you are in a noisy environment. Do not get this phone if your priority is to have a good speaker for phone calls in public environments (for music is is decent, especially when you like to hear it in a quiet place).7) Internet - the Wi-Fi browsing on this phone is much faster than the Wi-Fi on my Xperia X1, and E90. I can't comment on other phones. Scrolling through pages on the E90 was a nightmare. This problem is fixed on the E72. It also supports some flash content like you-tube, and for that, it is a very good phone for internet uses. For a non-touch screen phone, it's a good internet device. I actually prefer it over the HTC HD2.8) Price - for 330 U.S. dollars. This phone has the most return to each dollar you spent.If you guys are wondering:A) The accelerometer works with 3rd party software but has pre-installed settings to silent phone calls or alarms.B) The annoying animated-transitions between screens can be disabled in the phone settings.C) Do not buy this phone just because it has a customizable optical D-pad. It's not very good, and the reason I like it is to lock in the 'focus' when I take pictures.D) The Calendar, Contacts, and Messaging keys are completely customizable.
summary: Despite the other bad reviews, I bought this phone and did not regret it

The Powergen Mobile Juice Pack 6000 is an external powerpack with which you can recharge small mobile devices such as mobile phones and ipods as well as larger devices such as ipads. The unit comes with a variety of connections and in addition has a very useful built in mini usb connection which wraps neatly around the body of the charger, and which I was able to use to charge my Blackberry. It should be noted that Apple devices require an Apple cable or adaptor which is not included in the pack.Helpfully the Juice Pack came with a decent charge already so I was able to use it straight away without waiting for the device to charge up. However, charging it up is quite straight forward using any usb power source such as a laptop. Charging to full from empty takes between 6 and 14 hours depending on the power of the source. The pack has four blue lights along its front. When all four are lit it is fully charged, when three are lit it has a 75% charge and so on.The instruction booklet is clearly designed with someone with 20/20 vision in mind as the printing is tiny. However, fortunately using the unit is quite straight forward and one does not need to get a magnifying glass out as it is all fairly intuitive. The instruction booklet does give some examples of how far a full charge in the pack will go. It will charge an IPhone 4 for two to three full charges. Alternatively if used with an Ipad it will supply 55% of a full charge for an Ipad 2 or 35% of a full charge for an Ipad 3 which is still a useful boost if you are short of power.This is a very tidy and attractive little unit, measuring 4 inches by 1.75 inches by 5/8 of an inch and weighing a little over 8 ounces. Hence it is very convenient to carry in a handbag or pocket and with the inbuilt mini usb cable you do not need to carry around cables with you for many devices. I have also looked at the Juice Pack 9000 which carries a 50% greater charge. However, given that one generally uses this sort of unit for an emergency power top up, this will be sufficient for most people's requirements, and the size is certainly more convenient than the larger unit. One feature of the 9000 is that it is also able to recharge two devices simultaneously which may be an advantage for some.Having been caught out with portable devices running out of power, when out and about and with no available plug in, I find this sort of device really useful and certainly something that I tend to carry around with me. It appears to be a robust item. Very Impressive!
summary: Very Impressive and Conveniently Sized External Power Pack

reviewText: Amazon's page for this product includes a chart of Speck cases and their properties. This is their high-end protection, at the cost of relative bulk.Since the iPhone 5 is excessively thin, the bulk is largely a feature. Indeed, the primary justification of the iPhone 5's size is that it makes a solid case tolerable. For my tastes I'd have preferred a case that was 20% thinner.My only real objection, however, is the audio jack opening. It should have been shallower; many plugs won't fit. Seems a relatively easy fix for a future release.(PS. Reading previous reviews I think we're seeing a large number of counterfeit cases falling apart on early use. I suggest buying only direct from Amazon, though even that is no guarantee.)
summary: Quite good, except for  the audio connector

reviewText: All the other screen protectors I have used, have always been the firm, more solid, films. This film is a soft, very flexible film.The kit comes with some application liquid. I was worried about using it because the PS Vita's battery is non-removable. I just powered down the device and did  not turn it back on for at least 48 hours. (warm summer weather also helps drying time for any liquid that may have entered)As I applied the protector there was areas with very small, micro, bubbles. The film has some kind of adhesive and I did not want to pull it up and have it not stick again or disturb the adhesive because it may be a one time only application for the film. There was even a large lump of micro bubbles in one corner of the screen along with a wide row of these same bubbles down the center of the screen. I used a paper napkin to soak up any of the liquid that exited around the edges and the speaker area.Once all the liquid was squeegeed out the film looked terrible. There was also two places with some dust specks under the film. But the enclosed instructions said bubbles would disappear so I let it go. I first let the Vita dry up face down to give any liquid that may have entered the speakers a chance to run out.After about 24 hours, the bubbles shrunk down to half of what there was. Around 36 hours they were gone and the large lump of bubbles was gone as well. In 48+ hours when I went to turn the system on again, there was no sign of the bubble stripe that went down the screen, or the large lump of micro bubbles that was on the edge of the screen. The film even shrunk down around the small dust specks.Dust specks under the more common firmer films will show up as huge bubbles because of the air pocket the dust specks make. This film shrinks around the dust speck and you will have to hold the device at an angle and look for the dust specks to find them. This film hides them great!When applying the carbon fiber, I noticed some would cover the serial numbers so I opted out of applying the carbon around the edge and only applied it onto he back over the black area. The kit also comes with carbon fiber pieces cut out for Vitas with or without 3G door.I never want another one of those old traditional screen protectors again. If ArmorSuit makes them for any of my other or future devices, then they will be getting screen protectors by ArmorSuit.

As I just commented to another case similar to this.  It is a great design, and I love the kickstand... but this was the first of two purchased in the last two months because the holsters crack within a month.  I think it is time to find something a bit higher quality.Edit: Perhaps it is better than I originally rated it. I have never dropped my phone (Knock on wood.)  It is the stress of the case being in the holster has cracked each of my holsters next to the side tab.It seems I can't find a case that meets all of my needs.  I want a case that will cover the front face when I choose and has a kickstand so I can set the phone on the desk either vertically or horizontally.  This case met those needs but has a few down sides.  First, there is no tab on the bottom of the holster which leaves me feeling worried that the phone could fall out if I used the belt clip, so I carry it in my pocket.  Carrying it in my pocket creates another issue, when I pull the phone from my pocket then from the holster I have something in both hands and must then put the holster back into my pocket.There is another style which has a bottom tab and also allows you to place the case into the holster with the screen facing outward.  The kickstand is not on the case like this phone, but is on the holster only.  This is the other case I cracked prior to leaving my original review here.  I by far preferred that case to this one because the shell was reversible, but I had to modify that case because there was no way to plug the charger into the phone due to the location of the bottom tab.I'm still looking for that perfect case.

The iOttie is an amazing product line. Since buying my own, I've bought several as gifts. I've had people at intersections and drive-thru windows ask me where I got mine when they see me so effortlessly retrieve or re-cradle my phone.The best feature is the suction cup that will hold that cradle onto any - and I do mean ANY large enough surface without damaging it. I have a very textured dash that no other suction cup would work on. Glass was my only option with other model cradles and in my car, the dash is crazy-deep and I'm super short - so it was never practical to have my cradle on a windshield where I couldn't reach it to update my GPS app. This mounts very well on my dash without moving - even after being in the hot Texas sun all summer. They have a special mounting surface used in combination with the lever to create suction - and wham! That puppy sticks and won't let go until you want it to!
summary: Best car cradle for phones bar none

reviewText: Item arrived on 4/30 at 6pm (practically 5/1) rather than 4/28. The case is fine, though "you get what you pay for" kind of applies here. The sides are still pretty slippery despite other reviews. I am satisfied with the experience - but definitely nothing higher than that. So, 3/5 stars. More details on the case below:The people who claim the sides give the phone a nice grip are exaggerating a bit; or, perhaps they've never had a case above $10? I understand the Galaxy Nexus bare is very slippery, but this case doesn't add much more "grip" at all concerning the sides. Yes, I admit it is slightly better - but that's as far as I'd go if I were putting my word on it. To say it adds a nice grip is nonsense. The case is easy as all get-out to put on. You simply put one end of the phone in first (whether top or bottom), and then push the rest in. It fits snugly, so that's good - HOWEVER (all caps for a reason, this is important) - if you'll notice in a couple of other reviews, it is mentioned that the case kind of covers up the headphone pinhole, and/or mic, or some other part of the phone that shouldn't be covered if this case were made for this phone. I can attest to the fact that my case definitely almost covers up the bottom headphone jack pinhole. It's so close to not allowing headphones to be plugged in, it's kind of upsetting to think I spent money on it - it feels like it's not made for my phone because of this. Again, "you get what you pay for" applies here. However, headphones do still fit - and it's not difficult to get in and out or anything - so the functionality is still there. It's just concerning. You've been warned. Moving on - the best part about this case (and all of them, no matter the color), is it looks great. Come on, admit it, the main reason you clicked this case on Amazon is because of the huge Android ("Bugdroid"/"Andy") on the back - you want that on your phone! And, you should - it looks great and is a nice addition to any Android-powered device! Protection-wise, I don't know. It definitely doesn't feel flimsy in the least; it feels nice and solid/sturdy. At the same time, I know it's not the toughest case out there...brands like Seidio and Otterbox come to mind as tough cases I've had experience with.Despite my neutral review, I am contemplating picking a new color up. This "Smoker" color looks great in the Amazon photos here, but in person, honestly it's hard to see and looks more black than anything. I am wondering how the "clear" color shows up in person. Why would I pick another one up? - come on, this case is obviously a case for looks more than protection - I want one that I find the most aesthetically pleasing!Edited To Add: By the way, the item description on Amazon has a lie in it. It claims that it has "Precise cutouts provide easy access to all ports while buttons have been covered for protection from daily use", however no buttons are covered on this case for the Galaxy Nexus, at least. It's completely untrue. There is a cut-out for the volume rocker (button), and another cut-out for the power button (button)...I realize it says the ports have cut-outs, but it claims the buttons don't, and that's a blatant lie. If you're looking to buy this case but are concerned about this part, I'll be more specific: the charging port has a cut-out, as well as the mic, headphone jack, and speaker on the back. Even the 3-pin connectors on the right side of the phone below the power button, for the optional dock, has a cut-out. All have cut-outs. Do NOT buy the case if you want your stuff covered. DO buy it if you want everything to have open cut-outs, and a nice-looking Android guy on the back of your phone. :-P

This solid, metal, heavy stylus is ideal for large hands or anyone who feels that a slender stylus is just too difficult to grip.  The rubber tip is extremely sensitive -- I can swipe through an iPhone or iPad menu with the barest of touch.  The matte, all-black (except for the Frieq logo in silver) look adds elegance to an otherwise functional device.  I call it my stealth stylus.  If I were to drop it on a dark carpet or under a desk, I might need a flashlight to find it.The stylus is approximately 4 3/4 " long and 1/2" thick.  Some people, of course, will find the thickness difficult to grip while others will love it.  For me, the biggest drawback is the lack of a rubberized or textured grip since the body's one-piece construction makes it a little slick despite the matte finish.  The inability to change the tip doesn't bother much as it does other reviewers since it takes only a light touch to get the job done.  I don't see the tip wearing out quickly.I have small hands, so the chubby body is not ideal, although the sensitivity of the rubber tip is excellent. Since this is marketed as a wide grip, however, and since people who don't like this kind of thickness aren't likely to purchase it, it deserves close to 5 stars.  (Note: The manufacturer provided me with a sample to review.)-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: Like Handling a (Sensitive and Elegant) Jumbo Crayon (5- stars)

The RAZR Shell fits the phone like a glove. The assembled phone /shell fits snugly in the holster allowing for easy removal of the phone without being sloppy. The holster's belt clip is still tight and has plenty of spring tension after a solid two weeks of constant use. Some other holsters I've had got loose after just a few days of use. I have used this case for around a week now, its a love/hate relationship.The design is beautiful, I love the simplistic look and the flush buttons.It feels great in the hand and is not huge and chunky. They must of put a ton of time into the design, its got a nice lip on the front so they screen doesn't get scratched, the back is also raised so they plastic part of the case does not scratch either, buttons are very easy to click and clearly labeled.You just cant beat the price on it either, I would have gladly payed double.Now for the two fatal flaws, both from the back plastic.Yes I am aware there is two plastic films one on the inside one on the outside and I did remove both.The back is a total fingerprint magnet, to the point you can't see though it unless you are constantly cleaning it.The other issue is the camera, I thought something was wrong with my phone. All the photos were turning washed out and whitish. I finally took the case off and tested some pictures and magically no more issue. I think its the placement of the plastic around camera and the flash. Even without the flash on the photos are still washed out and white.It does have one other more minor issue. There is a sizable gap around the earphone jack and the bottomwhere the USB port is. After a matter or a day or two stuff collects in it like dust, hair and pocket lint. So every few days you got to take the case off and clean it or else it looks dirty.If it was not for these issues the case would be absolutely flawless. But I can't honestly give it a good review if I can't properly take photos with it.

reviewText: I LOVE this phone case! The color is less dark/saturated than in the photo and is the perfect shade of fresh mint (like the popular spring color of 2013 - I have a few matching shirts in this color!). I hate girly pearlized stuff, but the amount of pearliness in the case/color is the perfect amount to make the case look luxurious and bright and not too flat to look cheapie. I have always had clear or white phone cases for my white iPhone 5 (the white got really dirty) but I absolutely love and prefer the color of this (like a fresh breath of air!) and have not gotten sick of it yet and not had any issues matching it. The holes line up great for access to all the buttons and using the charging connection.The case is very very protective too - I drop it almost daily, sometimes onto pavement or cement outdoors from my Honda Pilot, and the case it still almost completely scratch free except for some missing green paint in the very bottom corners where it hits most often. The back still looks beautiful and pristine.Weirdly, I shared a cab in Vegas, and the girl who got in had the EXACT same phone case as me! Weird coincidence!! And she said she loved it too!

reviewText: WARNING: The Prevail is a DISCONTINUED 2011 phone with NO room to install apps.  It has been replaced by far superior 4G phones that cost less than $100.  The memory is so small that downloading just ONE 2014 app and updating the standard Google apps can totally fill the memory and the phone then stops working.The Prevail's extremely small internal memory requires you move as many apps as possible onto an SD memory card. You must delete an app before you add a new app. Do NOT update Google Maps or YouTube...the updates are huge wastes of memory.I was able to double battery life by turning off turning off Bluetooth and Wi-Fi, and turning off 3G phone service. The 3G phone service is NOT necessary for phone calls or texting.  I turn on Wi-fi or 3g whenever I need to download email or want to use the internet, and then I turn them back off. That extends battery life to 24 hours per charge. The free Android power widget toggles Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and GPS on and off with a single click. The free "DataSwitch" App toggles 3g on and off.
summary: Discontinued Phone With NO Room To Install Apps

reviewText: My first reaction to this backup battery pack for my iPhone was that it was perfect for my needs and did exactly what I wanted.  I could get about 4 recharges out of this before recharging it back to full capacity.However, it didn't take very long for the Anker Astro2 to start failing.  After only a few months it no longer keeps a connection with anything.  It will charge for half a minute or so and then the connection is lost.  It looks as if both USB input ports are a little wobbly and there's a perhaps a loose wire or something.  It's not as if I was really that rough with this item. It's now basically a worthless small brick.  Wasted money as far as I'm concerned.

For a universal holder, it really lives up to it's name. I got this mount to prevent my SIII and Nexus from jumping around the cabin of my car, and it does it's job admirably.It fits snugly on both my SIII and Nexus, without obscuring any of the buttons or connection jacks. Insertion and extraction are a breeze, simply place your phone and gently squeeze the sides closed to secure the unit, and the release button is on the bottom. The included DC adapter is nice, and helps keep these power hungry devices topped off. The suction cup is secure against the windshield, even on back roads and bumpy roads. It comes with a plate with sticky tape on one side, if you wanted to mount it to something that's not a smooth surface, but I found my windshield to be the perfect place. You can easily change from portrait to landscape mode by twisting the mount, to keep the kiddos occupied with a movie on those long car trips. Or, if you're like me, you can pipe your music through your car speakers and have a fully functional music player at your fingertips.Overall, I think this is a good fit for anyone who wants to keep their Galaxy phone at arms length or closer.
summary: Universal Galaxy Mount, both in name, and design.

reviewText: These seem to work fine for me.  They don't seem to last as long as the original, and certainly don't contain the NFC chip, but they work, and they're cheap!

It's enough juice to charge my phone fully about 4-5 times, and using it on a plane to stay ahead of my iPad charging while I play games was great!Works great so far and everyone I travel with wants their own.

I've had my SKII fo a little over a month now and find it a good fit for my needs.  I am a business user, not a Snoop Dog groupie, and this is a VERY cool device.Coverage in my area (Austin, TX is good)and while I have not yet traveled away from the IH-35 corridor, I had good voice and data coverage all the way to the TX/OK stateline (as far north as I went). For $20/month all you can eat data, this is a screaming deal.  I don't find the web surfing that useful (speed is about like a 28kbps dial-up connection) but for email it is superior to the Blackberry 957 I used a number of years ago.  The interface for the phone and for email and the address book is great.  Far better than any Nokia phone I have ever used.  The intellisync software allows me to create use a separate address book in Outlook that I can then sync with the SKII with a one button push.  Very simple and means you can have an abreviated address book if you are concerned about having this infor resident on TMO/Danger's servers.  I agree with another reviewier that it would be better that this info is NOT resident, but if that's a concern, limit what you leave on the server.Drawbacks are no bluetooth, no resident memory for email, pictures etc, no removable memory stick and no easy way to create and use your own ringtones.Great things, great keyboard (nicer/bigger than Crackberry), intuitive interface/software screen size/clarity. Camera a nice feature, easy to email pics anywhere. A very cool and functional device if you need phone and and email. The web and other stuff are "OK" but TMO data network will have to get faster and more WAP coded websites for content that is relevent for that to be a big reason to buy/use this device.I purchased through Danger's website total cost $0 after $200 instant discount and $100 in rebates. Worth a year's contract with TMO in my book.  Paying $49/mo for 3000 regional anytime minuets and $20/mo for all you can eat data (email, text messaging, etc, etc EVERYTHING DATA included).I would recommend this to anyone that really needs email and occaisional web service in addition to phone service.  Not the smallest/best coolest phone, but the best convergent communication device on the market right now IMHO.
summary: Better Device than Blackberry or Treo for my needs

I am reviewing this product as an assignment given to me.  I like the pink color of the cover and also like the fact there are other colors to choose from as well.  The price is appealing and I especially like the way the cover snugly fits on the back of the Galaxy S III. The case is thick enough to protect the phone, and very pliable to snugly fit on the phone.  It gives a sense of protection for the phone itself. My only concern is how is it going to protect the front of the phone, if you drop it face first on the ground or sidewalk or asphalt. reviewText: Ok, so I have gone through a bunch of phone mounts in the past and they are all the same: crap!!  They're usually made out of cheap plastic, are constructed in flimsy ways or have gimmicky parts that break easy... not to mention your phone usually doesn't fit they way you'd like it... but not with this mount!  This mount is hands down THE BEST phone mount you can buy... why?  First of all, it's perfectly engineered and constructed beautifully... the thing is heavy duty.  As a matter of fact, it's made to military specs and is used by the US armed forces.  The plastic is high impact, solid and sturdy.  The suction cup/device is also perfectly engineered... it' sticks to the windshield like it was glued and when you engage the mechanism it would take a gorilla to rip it off... and the heat from the sun doesn't affect it.  The pivoting device is also perfectly engineered... this particular model is made out of steel and has a spring for easy adjustment... the screw also lets you tighten it as much as you want without worrying about breaking it or stripping it out.  You can also add joints to lengthen it or to have articulate in anyway that you see fit.  Finally, the X-Grip holder is perfect for any phone, including the iphone and because of the design, you can have any case on your phone and it will still fit snugly.  I used to have an iphone and then I switched to the massive LG optimus G Pro and it fits just as good without me having to buy a new bracket.  It also has a lifetime warranty and is made in the USA.Listen, if you're tired of crappy phone mounts... forget all the others and get this baby!!  It's well worth the extra expense (but is still very affordable) and will last damn near forever.  GET THIS MOUNT!!
summary: The best phone mounts money can buy!!

reviewText: I saw the overwhelming amount of reviews, and the high marks, and did not even question this purchase.However after using this earpiece the sad truth is that the sound quality is just not good, plain and simple.  In some situations I have to ask people to repeat themselves multiple times - sometimes with no luck trying to understand them after 5 or 6 times repeating themselves - until I turn off the bluetooth and listen directly with my iphone that is.  It literally feels like "ahhhhhh" when I hear the true clarity of the call directly through the phone...I would compare this device to having not quite 20-20 vision....I have 20-30.  In every day life, MOST of the time, I don't realize I don't have perfect vision.  Until I'm driving and realize my wife can read the upcoming signs 5 seconds before I can.  And then when I put glasses on I see the world the way it really is - CLEARLY!  That is like this ear piece.  You can use it every day, for most calls, and it will be fine.  But there will come a point where you compare it to your actual phone or can't understand one and realize how muffled it really is.
summary: Sound quality just not good enough

Super easy to set up with an iPhone. You're ready to use the speakerphone in less than a minute.I have another speakerphone I've been using and it has slightly more features, of which I never use! However, when it comes to clarity, this speakerphone is crisp and clear. I have a sun roof and with my old speakerphone, I would need to close it in order for the other person to hear me, this one, however, picks up my voice even with the sun roof open and windows down. That is worth the price alone, because for me, that's all that really matters.One other thing that I do love, is that it plays my itunes playlist from my iPhone over the speaker.It also has a car charger so you don't need to bring it in the house to charge it.One word of caution - the range reaches quite far! I've been in the supermarket wondering why I couldn't hear the person on the other end of my iPhone, only to realize, they were talking over my speakerphone - out in the parking lot!
summary: No Need To Roll Up The Car Windows - Excellent Clarity!

reviewText: I hate to write a negative review for anything with Amazon's name on it, as I've enjoyed Amazon and their branded products greatly, but this product would be the exception.The charger in and of itself works great, provided that it makes contact inside your car's cigarette lighter socket.  In the case of my car, it doesn't.  It's just slightly too narrow to make good contact with the car's socket.I've used this charger in rental cars and it worked fine there, but they were different brand cars from what I drive.  So, nice charger, but I wouldn't carry it as my only car charger in a travel bag.  You never know which cars it will and won't work in.

So I saw this yellow polka dot tpu case and knew I needed to add it to my ever expanding collection of phone cases. I knew that it was coming from china so I knew to expect a painfully long wait for it, but I was prepared for that.When it arrived I was pretty excited. After taking it out of the packaging my initial thought was adoooorable print, the yellow is so bright and cheery. Downside, it felt incredibly thin and flimsy. I put it on my phone and held it in my hand for a few minutes debating if I should take it off or not. Ultimately I did take it off. I don't feel like it provides the same level of protection as my other 500 tpu phone cases. I also hate it when cases have just one big cutout on the bottom for the charging port and speakers, which is the style this case rocks.I didn't notice it until I started writing this review, but supposedly this case was to come with a keyring of sorts, and I never received that. It's not a big deal because what I wanted was the phone case, but it's something to keep in mind.Would probably not buy again.

Had it for a couple of days only. Looks and feels like it is a solid device. Sound quality is good both directions. Haven't yet tried the FM mode or the bluetooth streaming, so no comments on that however I don't expect surprises in that department as long as you keep your music quality expectations under control. To make it more hands-free the missing auto-answer feature would be welcome, but the answer button is really hard to miss so it is not a big issue. Also it is possible this feature will be delivered in a future firmware update.My only gripe is insecure mount on thick visors. While the clip should accommodate most visors out there the fit is definitely marginal on my Subaru Tribeca and I have no doubts the Cruiser will sooner or later fall down when the visor is lowered. reviewText: Delivered on time. Perfect wall charger which charges the phone quickly. So if u need a good charger can't go wrong with this one.

NT88C Car Charger:The product arrived in a timely fashion and in its original packaging. At first I had trouble getting the item work properly. Any slight movement would cause the blue lights to turn off and the item would stop charger. I soon realized that the spring connector on the bottom of the device was was arrested in the completely depressed position. I tried to "spring" it back to the fully extended position several times, but it didn't work. I then squeezed on the sides of the charge and it finally released. It appears to be working fine now. I'm hoping it doesn't happen again, but if it does, I'll know what to do.Both USB ports were able to charge my iPad 2 and iPhone 4S just fine (the 1 A a little more slowly). They also seemed to be able to charge several older iPod touch devices, a Duracell Powerhouse USB lithium ion battery, a Brunton Impel battery pack, and of course the New Trent LED flash charger (IMP52D).Pros:1. Small and lightweight2. Blue lights are an excellent idea when trying to find the USB port in the dark.3. Two ports.4. 1 A and 2.1 A options, but I'm not sure why you would choose the 1 amp option when just charging one device.Cons:1. The two USB ports are a little too close to each other. If the USB cables are a little larger than normal you can only charge one device at a time.2. Minor mechanical issues with the spring connector.Overall, I am very pleased with this item.

How about that, a case that's actually EASY to use. Your iPhone 5 easily slides into the clamshell design case and is easily removed as well. The high quality case is fitted perfectly and therefore holds the phone securely. Slim case provides protection without bulk and looks good.What I truly love is that they've designed the case so you have excellent access to all ports, switches, microphone, and speakers. You can use the phone and accessories without the compromise you have with most cases (where you often have to struggle to remove the case in order to to charge your phone, use headphones, etc.).This company has taken a much needed re-look at what an iPhone case should be and how inconveniences found in other cases could be avoided. This backup external battery has worked great for me, and my friends! I have constantly found a use for it, whether it is being at work for a day without being near an outlet, or spending a long day tailgating and being in a stadium all day.  It shows 4 circles for the amount of charge left, and with my S3, I usually get at least one full charge from each circle.  It seems as though I am able to charge nearly 2 full charges for each circle (total of 8), fairly quickly, if they get started before reaching 10% battery life.  I am very happy with how handy it has been, and how it has held up!

I bought this phone about six months ago.  I decided to wait until I have used it for a while so that I can report on my success stories.  Unfortunately, the phone stopped accepting or making calls about a month ago.  After spending about an hour on the phone (another phone) with TMobile and then an hour with Samsung , I was permitted to send the phone to Samsung for repairs.  After about 3.5 weeks, I received my phone, and it has not been fixed.  I just got off the phone with Samsung again, and I am on my way to send the phone back to Samsung again.  I hope that this time either they really really fix it, or they would replace it.  In the meantime, I will probably be without the use of my phone for another 3-4 weeks.Update,After four separate repair cycles, and a three month delay,  Samsung decided not to repair the unit anymore and send me a replacement.  Unfortunately, the replacement is an older used phone, which was probably returned by another customer due to its own set of defects.  I am now watching the phone anxiously to discover the defects of this phone, two of which I have already discovered.Needless to say, I am not happy with the purchase of this phone.Final UpdateThe so called working replacement from Samsung died five months later.  All told, I had 11 months of mediocre use from this purchase.ReflectionIt appears that, if one gets a defective phone, the Samsung repair department might actually hasten the demise of the phone.

Just like the Pre itself, the Touchstone is an adventure to unbox.  Everything is neatly packed in a way that looks more like a museum display than a regular consumer product.The back was fairly easy to change out on the Pre itself.  Following the instructions to work around the original cover with a fingernail to "pop" it off worked with a little effort.  The new induction back went on very easily.The "Touchstone" itself is surprisingly heavy and sticks better than expected.  On the first try, I did not get it exactly where I wanted it on the nightstand - I nearly lifted the loaded and heavy nightstand off the floor to get the Touchstone pulled free.The magnets in the base and phone back work to align the two so that charging can commence!  The only thing to be aware of is that when the phone is on the Touchstone, the face lights up with the time (currently, there is no option to have the phone remain dark while on the Touchstone).  If you need a totally dark room for sleeping, this could be a problem.I'm so happy with the Touchstone that I want to get a second for traveling and plan to get an actual piece of stone (countertop) to "permanently" mount it too since removing it once it's stuck is not so easy.
summary: The Easiest Way to Charge Your Pre

reviewText: The best thing about these headphones are they fit my head. They stay in place with all my different types of movement. The sound quality is very good. I have to turn the sound down listening to music. The range is good. It works with all my apps. The only two drawbacks i have is that the earpiece didnt fit my ear and the covers they provide where to big. i bought some different ones but overtime the earpice still hurt my right ear if i wore them alot. The second problem is if i am not playing my music then the sound when answering a call is good and the person on the other end can hear me clearly. If the music is playing however, when you answer a call the person on the other end cannot hear me very well even if i put the phone up to my mouth.

I bought this for my finances Sams Sung Galaxy III and he loves it. It is very sturdy and easy to place the phone in. He likes that he can stand the phone up while he works to see who is calling or texting. Very nice product.
great case, I would recommend it to anyone, I use mine all the time and the case also helps prevent sliding on tables or in the car
This has a great texture ont the back that just feels good in your hand and it makes the phone look great

Case arrived quick & in nice easy to open packaging. It fit the phone perfectly and all the ports are easily accessible. Camera/flash opening is obstructed at all; headphones fit fine. Power button requires a fairly firm press to activate but the volume buttons are as easy as before. I like the rounded edges and the fact that the edge around the screen is raised enough to set it down with resting it directly on the surface.Only complaint is with the included crystal screen protector. It fit ok with the openings matching pretty close to the front camera, speaker & home button, but it is slightly off. Mine came packaged in such a way that the bottom portion from about 1/2 the home button down was bent or crushed in the edge of the package so it had to be trimmed. Otherwise your basic screen protector.Overall great case & much cheaper than most others out there!

Pros:-Compact-Easy to set up-Works with both my Nexus 5 and 7 FHDCons:-Can be a little annoying to charge Nexus 7...it's magnetic to help you find the right spot, but can sometimes be a minor chore.-Short cable included for charger-A little priceyThis a great OEM wireless charger. I had no major problems getting it to work with my devices.Thank you!

reviewText: This is a great fit and it is easy to put on-there were very few bubbles to smooth out, which is nice! It also is thick enough to not allow my screen to scratch (even after multiple instances of my 3 year old dropping it), but thin enough that it still allows the touch screen to be as responsive as if there was nothing there!
This was not  charging dock for a Motorola Droid Maxx, so I returned it. No problem returning it at all.
this is a great cheap product and I really got a good use out of them, this is a great product to get

Purchased two of these items so the wife and I could watch TV at our own desired volume level. These work each time, and every time. If the power goes off, they will have to be re-paired, but that take less than 30 seconds for both of them.
These are awesome cases.  I love how they feel in your hand.  It is great to be able to mix and match the 'shell' with the colors.  You will not be disappointed in these.  Order them!
Good cover, good price. Protects very well. We will see if it streaches out over time like the last one I bought.

I bought this, used it for half a day, then returned it.  The little elastic pull tab is a bit... gimmicky.  It was indeed "snugg" - it was very difficult to get the phone in and out of the case.  I bought a case from Saddleback Leather and have been very happy.  The quality is 100 times better - since it's made with Full Grain Leather, instead of the cheaper materials that this Snugg case is made from.

The phone does not fit into this junky case properly.  Completely worthless and just a money grab by the seller.  It was cheap with the coupon code because it doesn't fit!  I tossed this case is in the trash where it belongs.  I realize purchasing a cheap case is a gamble, but I never expected it be so bad that it doesn't even fit the phone. Completely useless.

One of the hugely frustrating things about most external batteries is that they will not completely charge my iPad.  This OXA 30000 mAh battery is the only battery I have that can do that, and it still has power left over when it's done.  It can be used to charge a PC (not a Mac -- more on that later) or any one of a number of devices that use either USB cables or one of the ten power jack adapters in the box.  It comes with a power pack with an extra long cord (yeah!), a drawstring pouch, and a USB cable with various adapters (but not Apple's newer lightning connector.)I was a little disappointed that my iPad didn't charge more quickly when connected to the battery, especially since the USB output has 5.1 V output, more than enough for the 2.1 V iPad charging cable.  Still, the power is there, and I can run a depleted iPad off the current supplied by the battery.  The output for the laptop port (non-USB) is 19V.  I imagine that you could run a depleted PC off that kind of output.  Unfortunately, I can't run a MacBook off it because of the specific cables required to charge Apple laptops.  There's no adapter that will work.The OXA Frosted Box feels built to last.  It measures 7.75" x 5" x .5".  It's roughly the dimensions of my Kindle Touch, but, of course, much heavier.  I like that the battery is made to lie flat on a surface, with the output and input ports next to each other in the back.  The only thing it's missing is a second USB port for people who want to charge multiple devices at the same time.If you want lots of stored power for a PC laptop or a tablet, this battery is an excellent choice.  Note:  I received a sample for review.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: A Huge Charge Ready and Waiting

reviewText: Based on the reviews and the product specs, I purchased this case thinking I was getting the best bang for my buck... hard case protection with a holster AND a kickstand? Perfect... until I started using it.  The weight distribution of the S4 was in no way taken into account when making the kick stand.  The phone is very top-heavy when propped vertically, and the stand's axis of rotation is only 1/2 way up the phone. Therefore, if a strong breeze or a slight vibration hits the phone, it topples over onto it's back. Probably not good for the phone, no?  Now, only a few weeks after purchasing the product, the kickstand has BROKEN ALL TOGETHER! Very cheap construction. Only two small plastic pegs are holding the kickstand into the track. I guess it wasn't designed to use every day, since BOTH the top and bottom connections to the case have snapped off.What's more is that the overall design of the case leaves the corners of the phone vulnerable to damage!  Take a good hard look at the picture... the case's side protection ENDS at the top and bottom of the phone.  Therefore, if you drop it exactly on one of these unprotected areas, you won't have such a nice new phone anymore.Don't get me wrong, its a sturdy case. But between the corner-damage vulnerabilities and a cheap kickstand, you would be best advised to purchase another product. I'll definitely be requesting a refund.
No problem with this product only the problem was the phone. This works great and would buy again. Thanks for reading
summary: Work the way it say it works

reviewText: Very well made phone cover.  It slips right onto the phone without any fuss, but stays put once there.  Fits snugly, and has a nice lip that grabs over the edge of the screen to hold it on.  All of the cut-outs for the various speakers, mics, buttons and sensors are sized and positioned perfectly and the edges are beveled so it has a soft, professional feel.  Some earlier reviews reference a lack of cut-outs, this is clearly no longer the case.It has a very glossy exterior that somehow grips your hand and fingers very well, but slides into your pocket easily.  Best of both worlds.  It is a shock absorbing material that will absolutely absorb the energy of a drop onto a hard surface.  I've accidentally dropped my phone onto a hard floor (concrete) twice and held my breath each time.  Thank God it's not an iPhone with that "function follows form" hard aluminum edge that transfers all of that shock straight to the screen (which is why you see so many iPhones with broken screens).  The GNex is already made of a shock absorbing plastic material, this cover just enhances it.If you can afford a GNex and the monthly plan to use it, to not spend a few bucks for this cover is idiotic.  Just get it.  This plus a good glossy screen protector can be had for under $10, then you can feel safe taking your $700 phone out into the world.Well made, looks great, protects the phone, fits perfectly.

This power bank has many positives - bright flashlight, decent power capacity, charge status indicators ( 4 lights), automatically starts and stop the transfer to your phone, MP3 player, etc.  It can supply the full rated 1.0 amp output, but does not switch off early when charging my Sansa Clip MP3 player.  The second press flashlight setting is very bright.  Currently my favorite ( of 19 power banks).  The side power button could be accidentally pressed in a pocket or purse, but it takes a long press to turn on the flashlight.  A short tap lights the power status lights, then goes off again.  Holds it's charge well so far on sleep mode.Like most multi-cell power banks (greater than 3000mah) it re-charges quickly to about 3/4 then slows to a slightly reduced current while the cells are balanced, then creeps up to full power.  It takes longer but should extend the life by avoiding overheating and high currents.  When charging my Kindle keyboard, it supplies the full .85A current while maintaining a voltage of 4.84V - a good result.

In my opinion, this bluetooth outperforms many costing much more.  I bought it for myself initially after my previous one starting having problems holding a charge.  Once my girlfriend saw all that it does and tried it she had to have one.  Since then several people in my office and one of my good friends bought one as well and it is universally loved.  The sound is very good, the volume is loud enough for all but the loudest situations, the pairing was fast/simple, the range is exceptional, the battery life is impressive and the charge time is unbelievable.  15 minutes on a charger for a full charge!If there is a down-side, the earpiece options are excellent, however the soft rubber ear inserts are a bit fragile.  I tore mine removing it from my pocket so be careful with those.  If anyone knows where to get replacements please comment on my review.  If I find them I'll post it later as an edit. It still works, but probably needs to be replaced before it tears any more.One other note on the ear inserts: if you use the either of the ear loops you need to use the donut-shaped ear insert that comes with it.  It is removable and you can move it to either loop.  If you don't use it, it will tend to fall off and the volume will be too low because it doesn't bring the sound into your ear canal without it.

It's very pretty :) I'm happy I bought it. It seems pretty durable as well. The white isn't dirty yet. It did come with the paint a little scratched though, but I assumed I'd get some of that anyways through wear and tear. I like that it protects my phone with out being overly bulky.It is a PAIN to get off though, and it took quite a while to come in the mail.
This just came today and its about 2 weeks early, which is always a plus. Its simple and cute, I love the color.
I have no real complaints about this case except that it is SLIGHTLY too big around the charging port. Other than that, I love the case for my 12yr old son.
I finally got the case,looks really good for the price. The reason I gave it 3 stars is because the very first day I got it the stylus broke. But I can't complain about the price:-)

This case is a little slippery. It is not the soft, matted flexible case I was looking for. It is slick plastic.It wasn't what I was looking for, this could just be my fault, but the only thing this will protect are minor scratches.I don't see it really protecting anything other than some cosmetic damage and creates a small bevel so if it drops face down it should hold up from hitting glass first.
The Otter box fits great on my sons phone and now I don't have to worry about him dropping it and breaking it. The phone does get much thicker with the case on it.

I love my mount holder, now when driving don't have to fumble with the phone trying to see who's calling my phone is mounted on the windshield under my transponder, now i can decide whether to answer or not

After comparing prices with a large company that features this sort of item this set of Stylus pens for the Kindle was a real bargan..  The price was about 1/3 the price of one pen from the major company and the quality is just as good.  Thanks Amazon and Iwotou for the great deal.

reviewText: This extended battery for my Galaxy S4 is superb and comes with a new back to hold the battery in place. Though a little heavier than expected, one gets used to it quite well as the functionality of the phone is extended beyond any expectations. I love the product and strongly recommend it to those who (like me) need a phone to work well for at least a continuous three days of heavy traffic, both voice and data...
Screen protector provides good coverage and has the right cutouts for spearker and camera. Product is exactly as described and is almost unnoticeable after installation.

I have owned this for several months now with daily use to and from work etc and have had no issues. You can adjust it as you see fit including vertical vs. horizontal orientation, angle, etc. One thing to note from a phone standpoint is that if you are charging and using google maps navigation the phone gets pretty hot. In the summer I had the a/c on and it cooled it, in the winter if you run the heat that could be an issue? I think I would just run the defrost and not worry about it. reviewText: I am obsessive about protecting my portable electronics with covers and screen protectors.  Having installed 20-30 screen protectors over the last 15 years or so it is a chore I have come to dread.  Despite the extensive experience I still struggled with getting them on straight and with minimal air bubbles.  Installing this i-Blason screen protector was amazingly easy.  I peeled the first protective film back about halfway, lined up the top of the protector on the device, held it, then peeled the protective film back the rest of the way.  The protector wound up perfectly positioned.  Following the instructions, I carefully pressed down the outer edge first before smoothing the central transparent part.  There were no bubbles.  Period.  So it went on first time, perfectly positioned and with NO bubbles!  There are obviously less expensive screen protectors, but after this great experience I cannot imagine I will ever use a different brand.  The only thing that would have made it better if it were available via Prime so I could have gotten it sooner!
summary: Easiest screen protector installation I have experienced!

reviewText: Before addressing the hardware and functionality of this phone, let's address quickly the five-part equation that makes up your overall smart phone user experience:(1) the hardware...the phone itself(2) operating system software(3) installed applications(4) the network (overall, and where you happen to be using the phone at a particular time)(5) the service providerIn some cases, there are serial dependencies on the factors above, as many phones are tied to specific operating systems or service providers. Or perhaps you spend a lot of time in an area without 4G service. Just remember that even if you make a great phone choice, deficiencies in the other areas can diminish your overall user experience.Don't move to a smart phone without some research into these choices. Which provider? Which mobile operating system? Who can offer me the best service, or the best combination of value and service? The rest of this review assumes you've already figured out why a phone with the Android operating system might be a better choice for you than an iPhone, a Blackberry or a Windows-based smart phone solution...Bottom line for the HTC EVO 4G: feature loaded, user-friendly and a hard choice to go wrong with in a crowded smart phone market.The phone ships with an impressive array of capability and apps, and finding and installing new ones from the Android marketplace is easy even for non-techies.Two very strong performers in the pre-installed applications are Google-powered Voice Search and Navigate: both are eerily good at delivering search results and driving/walking directions. This phone's voice-to-text interface is also very good, and can be used for both composing text messages and delivering search results without typing. Surprisingly, a voice-based dialing app that is part of the operating system's collection of widgets seldom gets one right. The Evo's on-screen keyboard is adaptive to your compositions over time, and will suggest auto-completes for words you frequently type.The phone includes two cameras: an outward facing high resolution (8 megapixel) still/video camera, and a front facing 1.3 megapixel camera for video applications. It ships with an 8 GB microSD card. One surprising oversight of this phone is the placement of the microSD card inside the battery compartment. Although you can move files to an from it via the USB port, this phone would be improved if the card were accessible without removing the back cover.In addition to the USB port, the phone has a 3.5mm aux audio jack and an HDMI port.The rear of the phone includes a "kickstand", allowing you to stand the phone on a horizontal surface when viewing the display in landscape mode (great for using the speakerphone or watching videos).Customization of the scrolling display screens is intuitive. In our house, even less technically savvy users were re-arranging icons and applications in no time.Each of phone, video and still image quality are satisfactory.The overall finish of this phone is --literally-- quite slick. It can go sliding easily on leather car seat, and both the screen and frame will attract and display fingerprints. Whether or not you opted in to the damage/loss insurance that most providers offer, I'd strongly recommend both a screen protector and some case or holster to offer a modicum of protection to the phone.Mnay options exist for protection, but for our multiple Evo phones we've found the following to provide a good mix of protection and price:--"Fishbone" protective case (red linked here; other colors are available)--SGP STEINHEIL Anti FingerprintSprint Screen Protector (Anti Fingerprint)Let these protective devices soak up the wear and tear instead of your phone and display.Other reviews have discussed battery life, and it's worth addressing. This phone has five separate radio transmit/receive devices:-the standard cellular (3G/CDMA) transceiver-the 4G transceiver-Bluetooth (for short-range use of hands-free devices and data exchange)-GPS receiver-Wifi transceiverEach of these devices will exert its own demand on the battery. Selectively turning them off when not needed, along with setting a shorter time to turn off the display (2 minutes or 1 minute) will go a long way to mitigate the battery issue. Additionally, there are extended life aftermarket batteries (usually with an accompanying modified case cover to accommodate their their additional bulk) that will easily get you through your work day away from external power.A note about apps:Android is a Google operating system, and access to the Android marketplace for additional apps requires entry through a Google/Gmail account (either existing or one you create when setting up the phone). In return for the apps, be aware that you surrender significant personal information on your phone, your location (at minumum the nearest cell tower, and in some cases your GPS-derived location) and details of how you used the phone and applications. Providing this information is the cost of admission for functionality of the apps. I'm not offering a value judgement on this...just pointing it out for your information.Finally, a note about pricing:Comparison shop and pay attention when you're ready to make the move to a smart phone. For the hardware purchase, you can expect to find considerable differences in the prices (even when upgrade discount and rebates are included) from different vendors. Be sure to check out each each of your provider's "store" (brick and mortar, by phone and online), big box stores and even Amazon's new wireless store. It's worth investing a couple minutes in this research to save a considerable amount on the purchase price.Becoming a smart phone user begins with shopping smartly! )-
summary: Smart choice in a dense smart phone market; great features, functionality

reviewText: My previous charger cable had become loose to the point that I never knew for sure how long (if at all) my iPhone was charging. This Belkin Home and Wall Charger makes a nice, secure fit with my phone, and I like the fact that the plug is detachable so that I can charge/sync via the USB port on my PC or my car's charger.With 2.1 Amps/10 watts, it gets the job done fairly quickly, too.Next time I'd probably opt for a longer cable, although the 4-foot length is good for the car and for my charging station--anything longer would make for a tangle, defeating its purpose.  It also has a future in my suitcase when traveling.
summary: My iPhone gets a nice, snug charge out of this detachable charger.

reviewText: It fits perfectly and it was semi easy to install. There are air bubbles but not too much i dont think theres a way to get ride of that. but it has no scratches on it and still seems to look clean and nice.

I have to agree with other reviewers. The phone is first set in a plastic hard shell which is top rate. The hard shell is then put in a very soft rubber skin which isn't very well fitting to start with but is very poorly secured to the hard shell. As a result, you will find yourself constantly putting the rubber back on. Pull it out of your pocket? put the rubber back on. slide it into the cell phone sleeve of your bag? but the rubber back on, etc. I would consider rubber cementing most of the rubber to the hard shell and only leave enough open to remove the phone, but I am too lazy to figure out which cement would work and which cement would melt the rubber or plastic.

Fast shipping. Product as described. Works just like the original battery that I got with my Note 3.  I think more reliable and slightly longer lasting than the Anker brand battery I also purchased for comparison.

reviewText: Bought this because I wanted an inexpensive case for new iphone 5 while the buzz about it died down and the rest of the case companies built up their iphone 5 iventory. I put a Skinomi screnn protector on my phone, I also wrote a review about that. With that screen protector on my phone, and it's not bulky by any means, this case will not fit over the screen protector. It pushes it in and bubbles it. I have not encountered this problem before. Aside from that the case is glittered. I ordered black and it's black with glitter. The picture did not show that. I did contect the seller about returning the case but but they were not helpful. I'll just give it away to a friend if they ever get an iphone 5.

I gave the LX2 an honest hard try, I wanted to love it or at the least like it, but I don't.It is too heavy and large to comfortable rest on your ear for even more than an hour.I thought if I could get over its appearance it would be ok but everyone just asks "why do you have that dinosaur size headset?"Its battery life is also poor, lucky to get 45 minutes out of it.For something made to be a first person POV (point of view) camera it sure does lack an awful lot to help "capture those moments"Quality of LX2 is superb and didn't see any deterioration or cheap craftsmanship.If they can make it lighter, more battery, and bring it out of the prehistoric age it will undoubtably be a rock star of POV systems.I buy over 250 items a year from Amazon and always give an honest review in order to help those trying to make a purchase decision.This product rates 3 stars for lack of real world use ability but great construction.
works better than expected. the screen protector actually keeps dirt out unlike some other cases ive had before. great item
got two packs and shared.... LoL added leather leases to the ones I keep and work so much better than my 10 thumbs....LoL
I bought this to hold my Nexus 5 and to leave some room with the case. Worked like a charm. It's nice and study, definitely good quality.

I purchased this headset to use at work to listen to podcast and music. The headset has decent quality sound output and the battery display of the headset on my iPhone is helpful to know when it's time to throw it on the charger. I typically charge the headset at night and it lasts all day for me. The range isn't as good as on my original LG Tone. The call feature is nice though I'm frequently told that it sounds like I'm talking in a tunnel. I love having the volume, seek/skip, and play/pause buttons on the device. Overall it is a good quality headset.

It took about a month to get the Y Splitter cables.  I ordered them for a trip 3 weeks ahead and these cables still didn't show up.  I ended up going to Walmart to buy the Y splitter cables.  Avoid this seller if you plan on getting these cables anytime in the next 30 days.

This item stays in my car 12 volt outlet that works while my car is turned off.  I love the retractable cord and take it with me when I travel.  It is great to to have the cord able to be unplugged from the 12 volt connector, as that is not as bulky at other charges.  It is also great to have two USB connections so I can charge two items at the same time.  I have yet to figure out which side is the rapid charge, yet I find either side charges my devices at the rate in which I need them.
