I couldn't tell you the difference between and amp and a watt, but this Anker wall charger works great. I carry it now when I travel and use it to keep my Nexus 5, Android tablet and my wife's iPhone all charged up.The charger is no lightweight - it comes in just under 4 ounces, so there is some serious electronics going on in there. Two of the ports are dedicated to an iPhone type device and two are for Android. I know that there are differences in the power requirements for each, but frankly, it doesn't seem to matter which port I use. Having seen the socket hogs at airports before, this could be a great way to avoid fistfights when you need an outlet but all the plugs are taken!Like other Anker products, this seems well designed and maybe over-engineered. The only thing I wish it had was a rotating plug so that it could fit into every conceivable power strip configuration.  TIp for travelers - print your name, email address and phone number on a small piece of paper and scotch tape it to the charger - you're going to leave it in a hotel room someday (aren't you!) and this might just bring it home to you.
Soft and nice as I was expecting it. In time and great. Perfect for the spring and summer time..Thanks

On the whole, I'd have to say that I think this is one of the better Android devices on the market. I've used one from time to time and have helped several family members learn to use them and occasionally do minor trouble shooting for them, and they're really solid devices overall.One of the best things in Samsung's favor is that they take keeping their devices updated pretty seriously. The Galaxy S4 is in the process of being updated to Android 4.4, where some manufacturers seem content to toss an Android device onto the market and then pretend that they have no idea that updates are a thing that should be happening. This will be a less severe issue down the line, because Google is restructuring the operating system a bit to make it easier for them to handle updates themselves rather than leaving a lot of it to the hardware companies, but it's still nice to get something from a company who's serious about their obligation to provide a good experience even after they have your cash in hand.Other than that, this has a lot of nice features. The screen is good enough for just about anyone. It handles opening and running apps at a nice pace. There's a simplified interface that hides a lot of the apps and noise, which can be good for people who find smart phones a tiny bit overwhelming at times. You can use it with a Miracast tv/receiver to mirror the screen on a tv to show off things like photos and videos without asking people to crowd around a tiny screen. The camera is excellent for both photos and videos.The screen is just a bit large for people who put a very high priority on portability and using a phone one-handed. On the other hand, this size is just big enough to be reasonably comfortable for people who struggled with the teensy tiny touch keyboards on the earlier generations of smart phones. Whether you like the way Samsung makes Android look is a matter of personal taste. I like the Google Nexus devices just a little better, but Samsung's approach is a very long way from the worst that you can find on the market.On the whole, while this isn't my personal device of choice, I've been really pleased with them. I tend to be the person providing tech support for my family members, so I've used them many times and I've had the happy experience of not being stuck putting in a ton of time trying to get them to work as they should. I occasionally tweak a setting here or there and do little things like check to make sure everything's been updated properly, but on the whole the Galaxy S4's in my life have been about as close to trouble-free as any piece of electronics I've encountered.

This is a cute quality product, great if you truly do not have enough Micro USB cables and plugs in your house. I wanted to evaluate this on quality, and I have to admit the plug is my favorite. I love the color and how well made it is, but for thirty bucks I would have expected that it would have allowed for two USB to be connected to the one wall adapter and included two cables. Then I would see the value. It works as advertised and the cable is good quality as well. There are many cheaper alternatives that will work just as well and are brand name too. I highly recommend sticking with brand name when it comes to chargers because they far cheaper alternatives have given me problems in the past.
summary: Quality product but why so expensive?

reviewText: I purchased this in white as a replacement for an LG Tone that failed after about a year of daily service. I loved my Tone and figured this would be basically the same, but newer. It has some key changes which caused me to return the first one and now the second (in black).The pros:- The sound quality seems to be pretty good (I'm no audiophile, but it sounded good to me).- The form factor is the same.- It puts a neat battery indicator on the iPhoneThe cons:- The volume buttons are reversed which has me constantly moving the volume in the wrong direction.- Now it talks to me. This might be neat the first time, but the indicator beeps from the earlier one were just fine. These take a little longer to listen through. It's minor, but annoying to me.- The pause button does not work consistently with my iPhone 4S. The stop function works and serves largely the same purpose, but I don't want to have to hold the button down for a full second just because I want to hear someone who is trying to talk to me.This last is the biggest irritation for me and the reason I'm switching back to the previous version. The instructions clearly state that a brief push should pause playback and it simply does not do so - no reaction unless you hold it for a second until you get a beep.
summary: Pause does not work with iPhone 4S

I came across a pretty damaged iPhone and all I needed this part for was to repair was the power button. This part did exactly that, but it was one of the most difficult installations I had ever done on an iPhone. It's not so much that the part is tiny...it's the fact that you have to fold the ribbon cables perfectly and make sure it stays in place while getting everything attached. It also didn't help that I was installing this into a non-OEM back casing. That made the fitting just a little bit off. But that was the case, not this part. In fact, I held this part up to the original and it was almost indistinguishable from the original.The 5-star review is because this product works. It was exactly what I needed and it did it's job just fine. If I were rating this on the easy installation, I'd give it zero stars. But, nobody said it would be easy and for anyone who has ever worked on an iPhone, you know this all too well.
summary: Difficult to install, but does the job

reviewText: The PowerGen Mobile Juice Pack 1200 is a high-capacity lithium ion power bank for recharging most small electronic devices that work with USB.It has 1 A and 2 A USB ports optimized to work with Apple products (including iPods, iPhones, and iPads) plus a 2 A USB port for other devices. The included cables should be used in the 1 A port for optimal speed when charging non-Apple devices and Apple cables should be used with Apple devices.Output is up to 3 A simultaneously. The power output is shared between the 2 A outlets so if both of them or all three ports were used simultaneously, charging would be limited to 1 A per device. Practically, there is little reason to charge more than 2 devices at a time.Two cables of different lengths and two micro-USB tips for recharging the juice pack were thoughtfully included so the cables can be left in different locations such as at home and at the office. Several other adapters are also included for charging electronics from the power bank. The juice pack itself can charge from a USB port on a computer or television or from a USB wall adapter. It is a smart charger that will turn itself off once it reaches capacity. I was pleasantly surprised that it was delivered already fully-charged. When completely discharged, it will recharge overnight from a USB wall adapter.There are four blue LED indicators to show how much capacity remains. After charging a Samsung cell phone that still had half a charge and an iPod shuffle full discharged, all four indicator lights were still on, which demonstrates the high capacity of this model.As a bonus, there is a bright-white LED flashlight that is very useful and makes this power bank ideal to keep in the glove compartment for emergencies.The only tricky thing is that it is necessary to remember to press the button to turn it on for charging. The glossy finish does show fingerprints (I like that rubbery soft-touch finish on electronics) and the instruction booklet is in small print. It appears to be made as well as it works, definitely of excellent quality, and it certainly feels substantial in the hand. The dimensions are approximately 3 3/4 in. x 3 1/4 in. x 7/8 in. so it is easy to grasp.A sample was provided for testing and unbiased review.

Fits well and the hard TPU/polycarbonate case slides in and out of pockets without feeling that you are ripping out a vital organ. SPIGEN's Slim Armor Case offers good moderate protection against cosmetic damage or side and back falls. There is no face protection. The Gunmetal color gives a professional look to my white iPhone 5.Looks like something James Bond would carry around. And you feel that way too because you can get to your phone easily after gliding it from your pocket to quickly answer your call--Confidently.--Decisively.--Without breathing heavily.Know thyself.  If you need armor, that is available from other vendors. I am happy with the slim sleek profile for my iPhone 5 and recommend this to fellow travelers who need practical simple design without bulk or complexity.Addendum 5/14/13After needing to charge my iPhone, I was surprised to find no tab at the charger to lift up. There is a cutout, but it's a little too snug for a good charging connection with my plug and it means my connector is exposed. I went back to the original packing and saw the Orange "Caution" instructions "When charging backplate pull the TPU case in the direction of the arrow" along with an illustration lifting the case away from the bottom of the phone at Apple's "Lightning Connector" charging port. Though not a killer for the case (Note: Apple's Lightning plug does fit but need to verify a charging battery), this along with no face protection requires a downgrade in rating. I like the look of the case. I like the feel of the case. I am not pleased to answer and talk on a charging phone with the shell partially removed.I will still use this case when I need/want to have it in my pocket which is often enough. I will continue to use my olderBallistic EV0993-M175 Every1 Case for iPhone 5 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Light Charcoal/Light Baby Bluecase for routine use. The Ballistic is not so easy to pull from and gets stuck in my pocket, it has bulkier protection, it is 50% more expensive. But -- I like its features including face protection, flip up charging tab and sensitive touch buttons.
summary: Nice. Compact. Feels Good and Slim. No face protection. Requires partial removal of case for charging.

The window at the top is actually the same size as the bottom window.All-in-all, this case is totally USELESS.DO NOT BUY!
Charges my ipad and iphone at the same time.  Only one charger needed now.  Would buy again when needed. yyy
I would have had these in all colors if they had them. I wouldn't let this case go and I still have the it. This was sooooo worth my money. I definitely recommend this case.

In my business, if you don't have a cellphone, you don't have a job. I got this phone in the hopes that I could upgrade to a smartphone while still being able to perform my job. I had the phone in operation less than 24 hours when it malfunctioned (the ringtone had somehow been disabled through no fault of my own. Turned out the micro SD card I was using had interfered with the phone's processor, and subsequently, disabled ALL the ringtones). I missed at least 5 calls in one day, despite the phone being turned on and in my pocket, because there was no indication it had messed up. My supervisor thankfully called my private phone to let me know I was still needed. I, of course, immediately went to the local Walmart to purchase a new phone identical to the one I had replaced, since I could not wait for a new SIM card from Tracfone to reactivate the old one. The very next day, I got a stern verbal warning from the company's owners. I assured them the new phone had somehow malfunctioned in a manner that I was unaware of, but was immediately replaced with a more reliable one.The LG Optimus Dynamic is extremely unreliable. I cannot, and would not, recommend it to anyone if using a cellphone is your primary means of contact and employment.
summary: Phone unreliable, very nearly cost me my job.

reviewText: I didn't have any problems with this battery.  It was received quickly and worked just fine after charging fully for a few hrs.  It certainly lasts longer than the original battery that was included with my cellphone.
summary: WORKS JUST FINE/BETTER THAN THE ORIGINAL

reviewText: My wife is charging her iPhone on the way to work while I write this review. I like the dual capability since one of us (or one of our friends) is almost always charging a device when we're driving around. Yesterday, one of my friends went to eat with us, and he charged his LG smartphone while we were in the car. This morning, my wife realized that she failed to charge her iPhone over night and is able to plug in safely on the way to work. Overall, this is a safe, fast charge.Note: I received a sample car charger for review purposes, but the opinions are my own based on my own test.
It was everything that it said it would be everything came as expected and was able to be installed by a professional for a cheaper price.

Really expensive but this is the only headset that I have found that everyone can hear me and I can hear them - do play with the ear buds a bit since a good fit is essential to adequate volume - I wear hearing aids but take them off when using this and the volume is quite sufficient.  Well worth the money
A very cool product which probablt has been out for a while. Much better product then the ones that came with the phone. So far so good. I just recewive this product last week 3-30-14.
The phone was very useful to me. Was able to put my id and bank cards in the wallet side.

Very fast charger for our Samsung S 4's!  I ordered 3 of them and they all work perfectly.  I ordered them for use in our vehicles and our RV so that we would not have to take our chargers from home and if they get left somewhere we are not out a lot of money.  I measured the cord and it is 5 feet long!  So glad that I found them on here because that saved a lot of money!  Shipping was super fast.  Highly Recommended!
at first i loved it but then after a little while it started to stop charging my batteries, i no longer use it

This car mount is very sturdy and well-constructed. I love that it has the release button (other iOttie car mounts don't have this feature) and that it cradles my phone perfectly. i have had this protector for 4 months & has never had one scrach,, im buying another one for my new note2,, since someone stole mine :/ other than that it is worth it! :))

Been using this case on my SIII for about 6 months. It's a great case *except for the screen protector*, but replacing the screen protector couldn't be easier... Case slides well in and out of my back pocket. It's comfortable to hold. Buttons are all accessible and easy to use--jacks too. Case looks pretty good. And it has offered great protection so far (I've dropped the phone several times while walking. Neither case nor phone seems any worse for wear.) My only real complaint (screen protector aside) is that the rubber covers over the jacks don't close nicely like they do on an Otterbox Defender.As an aside, don't fall into thinking that it's the same great case in the Note 2 variety. It's not.

Fits snugly, great value, durable, no tearable or crack-prone areas identifiable, scratches easily, protects from drops well, doesn't snag clothing much.Buttons (volume, mute, sleep) are less accessible, separating phone and case is challenging (that might be a pro).Vote 3rd party.

40 watts of power will handle even the most power hungry tablets. Small in size with a long power cable, it fits nicely in small spaces.  Rapid and safe recharging for up to five tablets, phones, or any USB powered devices at once. A must for your desk! I have two with more on order!
summary: A must have for your desk!

reviewText: I ordered 2 of these holster/case combos and when I received them they weren't the ones in the photo. The ones in the photo CLEARLY have a hook at the bottom, the ones I received do NOT! So I went online here to return them and you can't. Its says its not eligible for returns or replacements. So I get stuck with something I did not order and I had to pay for it as well? I believe that falls under the heading of a RIPOFF!
This item was just as described and a great value. The clothes work perfectly and are large enough to take on any task I throw at them.

I received the item very fast! It was packaged very well. Compact box had everything that is described in the listing. I like this lens kit a lot! Didn't have a chance to play with it outside but just trying it out at home impressed me. Telescopic lens is really amazing! Love the little cute tripod. The only thing that I wasn't in love with is the case. I understand that it should be holding the phone very well....but it was SO hard to take it off from my phone. Maybe developers can think of other way to get it on and off from the phone without losing your nails.Overall, great toy for the price. I am happy I decided to get this kit and not cheaper ones since this one has EVERYTHING to have fun!

reviewText: Super duper happy when I found this on Amazon. A guest at my hotel had it and I knew I had to get me one. I knew I could count on Amazon to have it. I am very happy with my case. I especially love the price I paid. Shipping was free--even better. I would most definietly buy from this seller again. No complaints.

Yes it is a cute case but it has many flaws. It's very tight on your phone and ruined the top of my screen protector. You can't put it on without the protector popping off and I noticed after taking it off it even scratched up the top of my phone. Very disappointed.

I bought this film not knowing that it's an involved process to apply to my phone. So i stuck it out and put it on. 24 hours after, i still had issues. After reviewing the item on Amazon, i received an email with the offer to replace for free. (It was nicely suggested that it was faulty or maybe I just didn't apply it "just right.") That was a nice thing of them to offer so i accepted. I applied the film in the evening when i knew i wouldn't be getting a lot of calls, turned it off and let it sit for the night. I even left it off and gingerly carried it to work to keep around. Through the next few days the air bubbles finally left, but it still had the same issues of looking odd. Like my nails had pushed tiny ripples into it. Its not smooth flat and i get comments from people thinking it looks weird too. I think the film works well. It absorbs my nail marks, and any other nicks but i just doesn't look good. I think a hard plastic screen protector looks nicer and will be looking for one very soon to replace this. This was just not to my liking.
summary: Absorbs nail marks and such, but still not nice to look at.

reviewText: thankyou i like this used for my ipad and time i will buy more for this and save more money thankyou.

Just the right balance of protection and slim design.  The fit and quality is excellent - the sides don't 'peel' off and the case remains super snug with the phone.  So far one of the best cases I've had.  Definitely will purchase again.

My husband works construction and needs a case to do super good protection. this case is best so far. with that being said this case is best for people who don't like to change there case much as it is a pain to take it off and on.--The holster part of the case dose not hold your phone fitted good, it is a little loose like it may fall out, but if your not climbing around like my husband it be ok--Dust has gotten in under the plastic part so you will have to take off to clean off and on, and it is suppose to protect from that, but he works at a dusty place and there is no better case out for this.--All of the buttons and jacks have covers that open so like your charge port and headphone jack stays clean and covered and holes line up perfect.--you can use the touch screen well with plastic cover on, he has had no problem with this.-- the case is bulky so add's some weight and size to your phone,--I would recomend this case for someone who dosn't like to change there cases, and needs heavy duty protection and dose not mind the added bulk and weight.-He likes the case and is happy with it, but i have the same phone and i would not want a case like this so depends on your needs and how much protection you need it will protect well.

It is made of cheap plastic covered by light weight rubber.  It didn't fit well enough that I could turn the phone on with out moving the rubber so I could actually touch the phone.  After having it on my phone for 4 hours, I took it off and threw it away.

what can I say, its an otterbox.  Bought for daughter.  She loves it.  Gave it a 4 because it was really unclear that it had a built-in screen protector. Considering what the price is you can't really beat it for a casual user out for short periods of time however if you are into marathons and vigorous jogging I would  not recommend this product.

I bought my first to replace a failed charger and figured I'd take it on the road when our family travels since we have several devices that charge from USB.  I like that it has two high power outputs since we have iPads in addition to phones.  When my son's iPad charger failed he snatched my charger so I bought another one for myself.

not bad for the price, Screen protector is a bit complicated to put on......the cases nothing special! I do not think very protective

After purchasing my Droid and realizing the battery life time was much less than what I was used to, I had moment of panic about how I was going to make it through the day. the case works great i have dropped my phone plenty of times and hasn't damaged it! I would recommend to anyone

I bought these anti-glare screen protectors for my Samsung Galaxy S4, since I have always liked the ability to see the screen even under the sun, and the fingerprint-resistant feature. The Samsung Galaxy S4 is known for the amazing screen resolution and its high-pixel camera. After putting the screen protector on, you can definitely notice the presence of the screen, since it dramatically reduces the clarity of the display. Pictures are not as eye-popping as they used to be (without the screen protector). The matte finish of the protector, however, really enhances the swiping motion (if you swipe-type), as well as improving readability under the sun/bright light. I am sad though, that the display is not as vibrant as before. So I don't know whether I should keep it on or replace it with another clear film.
so far so good.  my wife and i got one each.  charges good and not one issue as of yet.
Can't expect much the price, but dang. This case is all flimsy and stretched out. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
Haven't used these yet they are in reserve for when my grandkid's come over and want to use my kindle or play on my phone
This gel skin is exactly what I needed. Slips easily in and out of my pocket. Will be buying more for my phone to have different styles and colors.
this case is one of the coolest i have. its a great color and the design is pretty awesome. Took a while to arrive but it was well worth the wait

I use this to both charge my phone and my Galaxy tab~ Great quality with larger ends that do not pull apart and break easily like some after-market chargers. Great product for anyone needing an extra or a replacement charging cable.

I really do like the design of this case, especially since I chose not to upgrade from the 5 to the 5S. Seems protective enough to survive a short fall.The only thing that bothers me is the durability of the case shell, as it has already started to show deep scratches from day to day use. I'm not sure if this was intentional by Spigen to sell replacement shells or if it was done to keep the product cost low, but this is the only issue that I wish was corrected.Overall, solid case for the price but be aware it will show wear and tear over time.

This is a perfect screen protector in my opinion.  After installing a Tech Armor on my wife's iPhone, I had to replace the less expensive one that I installed on my Galaxy S3.  Tech Armor includes everything needed including a card and patch of soft-cloth to aid in smoothing out the bubbles between the film and screen.  After installation, I only encountered a tiny persistent bubble on one corner.  Follow the instructions to a tee and you shouldn't have any problems.1. Die-Cut was a perfect fit.  Cut-outs for microphone, home-key and front camera are perfectly placed.2. Clarity is so near perfect that I rate this 10 out of 10.There are less expensive alternatives and a few more expensive ones, however I am certain that this is a complete solution with installation aids to make the job easier.
I bought these for my wifes phone and they acutally are great screen protectors.  I will be buying more from this company. Great product
Works fine with my iPhone 4S, and it has velvet on the inside which could cushion some contact if you drop your phone. Design-wise, I don't think it is pretty, but this really depends. :)
Very short and easy for my puppy to hide or bite off the ends. They do work very well on my Ipad and Iphone and my husbandsandroid phone and tablet. Keeps fingerprints off the screen.
I just got the case and I love it. It makes my Samsung galaxy epic look and feel great. I feel like I have a new phone.

It is holding my smartphone quite well.Update: after about a month or so, I've seen that the grip on the ball joint is VERY loose, as the weight of the cell phone alone is enough for it to droop down and be unable to be viewed.

I love the fact that music streams wirelessly to this speaker box.  It also sounds so much better than just using your phone and it's small enough to be portable to any room in the house.  However, I do think you are paying for a bit of the brand name and style and while the audio is good, it's not going to compare to a full stereo system setup (which should be obvious).  All in all, I am happy with the purchase and would recommend this, especially if you can get it for a good price.

reviewText: The fit for my EVO HTC is PERFECT!  The price is very reasonable.  However, applying the screen protector is not easy.  The tabs that come on the protector that act as step one and step two left glue on the screen.  Of course the glue did not come off and I had to toss the first screen.  I started to apply the second screen (comes in pkg of 3) and was very careful removing the applying tabs.  A very little bit of glue stuck on this screen as well, but it was in upper corner and not real noticeable, so I finished applying the screen.  It did take quite a bit of effort to work out the air bubbles, but when finished my phone responded faster and more accurately due to my previous screen cover was worn out.
summary: For the price, it works with some effort

reviewText: Really liked the Commuter series better than the Defender because of its size - the Defender isn't pocket friendly for women but will fit in a suit pocket.The Commuter series has the snap on outer case with rubber underneath exposed on the corners so it absorbs shock in the places most likely to cause cracks when dropped. I gave my Commuter case to my sister after she cracked her screen and she loves it. No issues with camera or microphone holes, both are cut to fit pretty precisely. One caveat is that it is a little hard to push the buttons at first, but it gets softer once worn in and hasn't posed any problems. Also, since the back is hard plastic it can be fairly slippery, and can't be placed on a tilted surface without sliding, even on my lap on the train. That is the main advantage of the Defender case which I replaced it with.I got the Defender case for myself thinking it would be much better, but because the soft rubbery layer is on the outside it is prone to stretching. It is still a great case and I haven't broken my phone (though I've dropped it literally dozens of times - on rocks, on the train platform, on carpet, on bathroom tile) which is a pleasant change for me.The customer service is also great - when the outer case did stretch it was within the year warranty so I just uploaded a picture with my name and address pointing to the defect and Otterbox sent a new one. I presume they would do the same for the Commuter Series. So far have had the new case for two months and no signs of stretching, so perhaps the Defender they sent me first was just defective.

This is a fantastic case that offers great protection with out adding a great deal of bulk and weight. The reason I only gave a 4 star rating is the power buttons and volume rocker are a bit stiff and do require some effort to push. But with 2 weeks tines have noticed some improvement. Maybe after a couple of months the rubber will wear in.

Great case that shows off phone while protecting it.  Black gloss band around outer edge gives the black iPhone a very stealth look. Have only had this for a week but it has yet to pick up any scratches or scuffs.  Hope this bodes well for the future.Buttons all work well, silent switch is a bit more difficult to get at but manageable.Would highly recommend springing for the extra $'s for this case**************** Update March 6, 2014 ***************After 4 months of knock around use I'm happy to report that this case still remains scratch free.  Pretty amazing in my book.  Would not hesitate to buy again or recommend to a friend.
Well-constructed and tough.  Was exactly what I was expecting. I think it would protect my phone better than other similar I have purchased.

I had this headset originally, and then lost it.  After I lost my original, I figured I'd give a motorolla one a try, and purchased the most expensive motorolla on the market (H700).Using my treo 650, I COULD NOT HEAR ANYTHING people were saying, and got constant complaints that the people I was talking to couldn't hear me well.  The volume was terrible, and so was the sound quality.This headset is SO LOUD that i have to keep it on the 3rd from highest setting.  The clarity is great!  People think I'm talking on a land line.  For the $35 bucks, I bought a new one and chucked my motorolla in the garbage.IM SO HAPPY TO HAVE MY SCALA BACK!

Otterbox MOT4-ATRX2-20-E4OTR Commuter Series Hybrid Case for Motorola Atrix 2 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - BlackI purchased this item for my husband's soon-to-arrive Motorola Droid Razr Maxx.  The Otterbox Commuter Case arrived in pristine condition and was obviously brand-new.  It fit the Razr Maxx perfectly.  It was easy to assemble/put on the device.  The screen as well the surroundings are all protected.I realize that this review is about the Commuter Case, but I wanted to share my rationale for purchasing it after I had such a positive experience with the Otterbox Defender, so please skip this paragraph if this is not a concern of yours.  I currently have an Otterbox Defender for my iPhone 4S (I actually purchased the case for my iPhone 4 (CDMA-Verizon) and saved the case to use with my upgrade to the 4S.)  This item has protected both phones so well- especially considering the fact that I have dropped each one on more occasions than I would care to admit.  It's a bit clunky, I will admit, but considering how often this has fallen from at least 5-6 feet onto concrete or asphalt, it is an absolute must for me.Back to the Commuter Case.  I read the reviews and because they range from stellar to less-than stellar, I was a bit hesitant to purchase this case. However, I had purchased the Commuter Case for my son's iPhone 4 (the one I handed down to him so that I could upgrade to the 4S  =) and he loves the case. Both the case and the iPhone have survived his freshman year in college.  I am equally (very) impressed with the way the Commuter Case for the Motorola Driod Razr Maxx fits the phone.  I purchased this as protection for my husband, who is a minimalist and wanted the least amount of bulk possible to protect the phone.  He is pleased with the cover as it is lightweight, fits the keys exactly, and provides the needed protection.Because he is not the klutz that I am, he will probably rarely if ever drop his phone thus will most likely never require the protection the case provides.  In fact, his phone/case will probably not even end up with a scratch on it.  But for peace of mind and total protection that does not add bulk- I can't think of a case better designed for it's function.  Oh, and by the way, it's a great looking case as well.P.S.  I now need to go back and write a review for the Otterbox Commuter Case I mentioned above that I purchased for my son for his iPhone- he survived his freshman year and so did the phone, thanks to the cover!!!  It's part of the reason I felt confident in purchasing the same brand/style case for my husband's phone.

I recently bought this cable for my iPhone5 & 5s..after reading some reviews i was abit septical about it but upon recieving it I was surprised.The cable is thick and strong worked on both phones and my iPad mini, it fit quite well on all my idevices. The price was good as well. Its a good cable for travel use, to leave in the office or as a spare at home. I would recommed it as a back up. NOT BAD AT ALL...
Really like this charger.  Much sturdier build than anything around the price.  Plus it does not give the message that this charger is not genuine apple.  The cord length is perfect.
I don't like this cover because it looks cheap on then phone. And the sprinkles are falling apart. Everything in my handbag is now covered in the bling that comes withbthis phone.
For the price you can't beat it.  I wanted a electric current charger for when away from the computer this works nicely and is a good price.
The headset fits great but if it's going to work at all I have to be within 10 feet of my smart phone.  There must be better products available.  Search around for other headsets.

This is the first case I've bought for my Galaxy Note 2. Other case I have is a heavily bedazzled sugarphone case and I'm also waiting to get my official samsung case + cover in mail.I like this case because it was so easy to set up, only a back cover to snap on the back of phone. Other cases have a front and back that snaps together and makes it a pain to pry off.Taking off the case is an easy task...no prying it off...My galaxy note 2 came in white so this case's white color matches perfectly. It has a satin finish; looks matte but has a slight silky feel.I have used this case for a month now and I'm not gentle with my phone and there are slight scratches on it but they're not easily visible.The cut outs for the power button and camera are well placed. The microphone and stylus pen cut outs are only slightly covered since this case only has a back and not a front part to latch on to.The only issue I have which on a scale from 1-5 (1= not caring) is a 3ish...the hole cut out for the volume isn't as well place as the cut out for the power.The cut out isn't centered on the volume keys so my finger always runs under the keys and it gets annoying if I'm trying to rapidly silence the phone or change the sound while driving. I kind of have to dig my nails into the volume keys to push them down.Personally, I believe official samsung cases are intrinsically created for maximum effectiveness and ergonomic placement BUT they have that annoying flap that covers the screen so if you're looking for an easy to snap on, minimalist design, I'd still recommend this case!

After researching for a good, fair-prized phone to replace my Samsung Galaxy Nexus phone {because it fell down and cracked (but still works ok), and needed something more modern}, I decided to buy Samsung Galaxy s2. I choose it because of it's fairly large screen size, light weight, and versatility applications. So far I'm not disappointed (used it for almost two weeks), performs greatly (no hiccups and switches apps very smoothly). I have even upgraded it the Jelly bean android 4.1.2 version with ease, and it's still working greatly. I only followed the instructions from Samsung support page to the letter!Over all great phone, especially for those who are not ready for Galaxy s3 or 4 yet. This will more than give you what you need- it's all a matter of application! Though I haven't used any of those I'm wondering if there will be much difference in functions. The battery is the problem so far- runs down quickly so that you're constantly charging. Maybe because I use it a lot, and run many applications on it!
this is another color i got for my son and it also is a great color, this gives him a verity.

I received this case a couple weeks ago and wanted to take some time to use it before writing my review. My first impression of the case was that it's a bit thinner than what I've come to expect from Otterbox, but coming from someone who prefers a thinner profile this isn't a bad thing.The exterior of the case has rigidity but isn't a typical hard plastic. The case has internal support which allows it to have a softer exterior without compromising rigidity. The exterior is textured which makes the phone stay more securely in my hand.The case came with a screen protector. This went on easily and free of air bubbles, thanks to the included "squeegee". If I'm being nitpicky my only gripe about the screen protector is that it's not any too big. I would have liked it to be just a tiny bit wider (it barely covers the corners from left to right) but it does cover the entire screen and that's what's important. After a couple weeks of use the screen protector is still securely in place and isn't showing any signs of clouding/scratching or peeling. My screen still looks crystal clear through the protector.A few highlights:The front of the case is raised away from the screen which allows me to place my phone face down on a surface without having to worry about scratches or damage.The cutouts for the various ports and speaker/camera on the back are perfectly cut and clean. The cutouts for the camera on the back are also raised allowing me to place the phone face up without having to worry about damaging the camera lens.I like the carbon color of the case. The color is a very dark gray and looks nice on my white S3.A few gripes:The width of the screen protector (as noted above).The side buttons are harder to press with the case on but the design offers more protection this way so it's a trade-off.The exterior of the case does show scuffs/scratches due to the material but they wipe off with a damp cloth.The case does add to the size of an already large phone (Case thickness measures at approx. 1/2") but this is to be expected with any case that offers a level of protection.Conclusion:Overall I'm very happy with the case. I feel like my phone has an adequate level of protection without too many sacrifices. I would recommend this case to anyone who is looking for a medium level of protection without too much bulk.
After dropping and breaking my phone for the 3rd time while working out I decided to buy this and I am so glad I did. Its great to have. the only thing that is an issue is changing the music.
I was unable to use this because either the touchstone went out as soon as I got this, or it never worked in the first place. I'm glad it was so cheap.

reviewText: This is one of the coolest design I've seen.  It's practical and the flexibility and the sturdiness of the product makes it even better.

The charger looks nice, is very compact and fits my naked iPhone perfectly. This is the problem with it. Unless you use a minimal plastic case (which only offers scratch protection) the charger won't fit your phone and they should have realized this and planned the base accordingly.I love the charger but the reality is that for most people this base is actually useless.

AmazonBasics Leather Case with Swivel Clip for BlackBerry Curve (Black) is a great all-around case for the Blackberry Curve.  The case is light-weight, yet sturdy.  The top flap has a strong magnetic closure that keeps your Blackberry Curve securely in the case when not in use, but is easy to flip open and release when you need to use your phone.  The large clip on the back of the case was fairly sturdy, but made of plastic, and attaches well when clipped onto clothing.  The clip has a firm grip, but it is also easy to release when you need to remove it.  The leather is supple and soft and the stitching on the case is well-done and strong.AmazonBasics Leather Case with Swivel Clip for BlackBerry Curve (Black) is a good product and a great case for everyday use.
I use my phone way too much and I needed something for when I'm out. I've had this for a few months now and it charges my phone fast. It fits into my purse easily. I highly recommend it.

This is actually a quad-band mobile phone which makes it a true 'world phone'... more so than the common tri-band devices.World phones are generally equipped w/ both 1900 and 1800 frequencies. Together, these frequencies cover Europe, much of the U.S. and many other countries. Most tri-band units, however, are usually equipped with either 850 or 900mhz.850 fills in the 'rural gaps' in The States. 900 allows for roaming in New Zealand and Australia. Whereas both T-Mobile and Cingular operate on GSM frequencies and therefore can offer world phones, Cingular operates on the 850 and T-Mobile on 900. They allow each other to use their frequencies for instances where they don't provide a needed frequency... provided you device is equipped w/ both 850 & 900 mhz as is the Motorola V330.How is T-Mobile? Truth of the matter (as with any mobile phone service) it comes down to the region you live in as well as what building your in and the area that building is in. Sorry, there is no across-the-board answer. As soon as one gets great reception, his/her neighbor curses it.Visually, this phone is indistinguishable from just another flip phone, but it offers rather large and well-spaced keys. The screen is vivid and bright. The ringtone gets plenty loud. For these reasons, it's a great phone for seniors who still want a modern phone. I just got one for my mum.Of course, being a quad-band, video, camera, multi-zoom, bluetooth, infrared device w/ browser, the general ease of operation can only be so easy. That 'said,' many a senior probably couldn't be bothered w/ messing with it all or putting to test call quality in rural U.S. and New Zealand.That you get all of this and at such a price makes the V330 an eyebrow-raising steal.One more thing - That it's blue, not the de riguer black or silver, I like.A quality phone packed w/ a host of goodies. Go 'head on, Motorola.

I got this first for my Moto X. I had used other brands before, the ones that use the wet method to apply. The ones that use the wet method are better, but can be very difficult to install correctly. So I had used Tech Armor before for my Tablet, and it works great. But for this phone, it just does not work. It causes a darkening and rainbow effect to the phone. So for me it deteriorated the quality too much. For a larger tablet the very slight loss of quality was fine, but for a small phone that you look at all day everyday, I just did not like the loss of quality.It is very nice that they give you 3 of them, because I had to use all three to get it right. The first two got dust under them no matter how quick I tried to put them on. The third one had one tiny piece of dust, but it was at the top of the phone not on the screen, so I left it on. But after about week, I took it off, again, because I wanted better optical quality.I got another brand after this, one that uses the wet method, but I have not liked it either. I would say that this protector is better for this phone.UPDATE March 22, 2014.Tech Armor was adamant about contacting me to give me great customer service. And while I did not want any replacements, and I think this is a good product for many applications. Tech Armor went out of there way to give me great Customer Service. I would recommend anyone give any Tech Armor product a try.
summary: This is a good brand, for tablets. Great Customer Service Company.

reviewerName: Lisa Shea "be the change you wish to see in t...
reviewText: I am always fascinated by the number of electronic devices the average modern household uses. Many of us leave these "energy vampires" - like VCRs, DVDs, cell phone chargers and other things, plugged in all day long. They drain our electricity and rack up our electrical bills! How can you know how much money they cost you? The answer is the Kill-A-Watt device!P3 P4460 Kill A Watt EZ Electricity Usage Monitor Operation of this device is VERY easy. You lug the Kill-a-watt into your power outlet. Then you plug your electronic toy into the Kill-A-watt! That's it! Instantly the device starts figuring out how much electricity the electronic object is using - EVEN WHEN IT IS OFF. A lot of devices like cell phone chargers sit there drawing electricity all day long.For example, I leave my laptop plugged in all day. I have it "shut down" - but it's plugged in. It turns out I'm paying $3.76 a month to have it sitting there. I know that might not sound like a lot, but if you start multiplying that by all the other objects in your house that stay plugged in, it can add up quickly.Just how much is that old computer of yours costing you? It might actually be MUCH cheaper to buy a new one that consumes far less electricity, rather than powering the old behemoth every month! You could be amazed at the amount of money you can save, just by unplugging some things when they're not in use. Invest in some power strips with on-off buttons. Turn them to OFF when the items are not in use, and see your savings soar.I love that you can program in your current electrical cost - this is always found on your electrical bill. So for my home in Massachusetts that is $0.187 per kwh. The device then lets you see - at the touch of a button - how much the current object will cost you each hour, each day, each month, each year. The longer you leave the specific item plugged in, the more perfect your reading is, as it averages the device's fluctuations over day and night.HIGHLY recommended. This is perfect for any frugal liver, to determine exactly what devices in their homes are energy hogs and to organize what to do about it.
summary: Super Easy, Great Money Saving Device

reviewText: The main selling point of these headphones is that they can connect wirelessly to any bluetooth capable device, such as cell phones, tablets, and computers.Bluetooth Connectivity:Connectivity is pretty simple -- hold down the power button on the headphones to put it in pairing mode, and open up the bluetooth settings on the device you wish to pair it with to make the connection.Audio Quality:The sound quality is ok. It's a bit thin and shrill -- it sounds like some compression has been added. I suspect that some data is being stripped out to accommodate Bluetooth's limited bandwidth. It's most noticeable with music (to put in perspective, my 9 year-oldSennheiser HD 497 Headphonespurchased in 2004 for less money sound significantly better). If you're listening to just people talking, such as the news, the sound is fine.Talk:The headphones can also be used to take phone calls when paired with a phone, and the microphone on the headphones can be used with videophone services on a computer. The sound quality of the microphone is on par with just about any other Bluetooth headset.Problems:The battery life display on iOS devices always shows 1/4 full even when fully charged. There battery life display on the headphone set does not work.Conclusions:Despite the issues mentioned above, the primary reason for getting these headphones is for situations when you want to be wireless. I've found it to be quite useful for everything from exercising to cooking. But they audio quality is simply not good enough for serious music listening.

I purchased from mine SF Planet, and I do recommend purchasing from them.The first screen arrived and after installing it, it left much to be desired. The contrast ratio was terrible, and there were bright spots on the screen. SF Planet was relatively quick to offer a replacement, and ended up sending me a much better screen with an apparently OEM LCD and an aftermarket digitizer from what I can tell. Get a screen protector with these replacement screens, as the Apple installed oleophobic coating was not on either of the replacements I dealt with.I did a little research to see how to determine an OEM part vs a cheap knock off, and found that the OEM parts say Apple on the digitizer and LCD ribbon cables; on my (better) replacement screen, the LCD cable does say Apple, but the digitizer cable does not. Also, if the metal backing of the LCD has a nice mirror finish (after pulling off the blue protective plastic, you'll likely be happier than if it doesn't. The original broken screen's metal backing was mirror, the first replacement screen I received not a mirror finish - bad times. The second replacement screen I received was mirror finish like the original screen, and the LCD looks identical to the original screen.I now have the phone in an Otterbox Defender after my son dropped it and broke the original screen. Live and learn.

First things first, make sure you are ordering the right headset.  These fit a 3.5 mm jack, NOT the old 2.5 mm that you would find in most other/older phones.  Easy way to test if you're not sure, take an iPod headset (or any headset you use for a mp3 or CD player), and see if it fits.  If it does, than you are looking at the right headset.Before getting into too much detail let me first give a concise Pro/Con summation:Pro:Best earbuds on any headphones I've ever used.Con:The microphone is as equally bad as the earbuds are good.Despite being slightly shocked by just how good the earbuds were, these are of no use to me if the microphone is unusable.The Sennheiser MM50 iP Earbuds / Headset have the most outstanding sound I've ever hear from a headset, but an incredibly BAD microphone.  Also, the Sennheisers were engineered to keep the microphone close to your mouth by placing it at the Y of the headphone split, and making on line short enough to pull the mic close to your mouth.  This is an awful design that should never be repeated.  I found myself constantly having to repeat myself when talking on this headset.I can say though, that with the Sennheiser Earbuds, I could hear details in my music that I never heard before.  A simply amazing sound, with outstanding isolation capabilities.  In a very noisy gym, I could keep my iPhone at a low volume and still hear great detail to my music.In comparison, the Ultimate Ears MetroFi headset keeps the normal, symmetrical Y shape to the earbuds, and places the microphone on one of the lines, close to your mouth.  Having my wife call me on her Chocolate 3 phone, I was at first disappointed. "Did you forget to bring the headset with you?" I asked.  Nope, she had them on.Over the years, between the two of us, we've probably used about a dozen different headsets between the two of us, and the MetroFi set was the clear winner when it came to microphone quality.  Funny thing is, to look at them, you wouldn't think it.For earbud quality test, I compared them to my Sony, J2, Metrofi 170vi, and iPod earbuds (all noise isolating except the iPod).  Sound quality places the MetroFi 170vi down by the iPod headset, and sadly, they were probably equal to the iPod headset for noise isolation as well.  The Sony and J2 earbuds were roughly equal in both categories, far behind the Sennheiser, and slightly less far ahead of the MetroFi 170vi and iPod set.Comfort wise, I would rate the four as follows: Sennheiser (again, by far), MetroFi 170vi, Sony, then J2 (So bad, they caused one of my ears to be sore for days)Durability could probably be a little better, but they haven't failed me yet.  So far, just one of the 1 1/2 inch sleaves, attached to the earbuds has come off.I would recommend the Metrofi 170vi set over these.  IMHO, when wearing headphones that are also a headset, microphone quality trumps headset quality.edit 11/28/2010I earbud died shortly after this review. It kills me, 'cause for comfort and sound quality, nothing beats these... nothing even comes close to these. Unfortunately, a crappy mic, and poor durability make this a lousy product.
summary: Incredible earbuds don't make up for poor microphone

reviewText: Packaging is beautiful but we didn't buy it for the throw away box.First of all, it's not Qi compatible.  Many reviewers have already mentioned it.I don't have a powermat so I can only review the USB charging results.The USB charging is slow.  The indicator blinks forever without letting you know when it is fully charged.It charged for over 8 hours today and was still blinking.  When I finally picked it up and found it cool, I realize it's not charging anymore. (Initially it began to feel hot in about 1-2 min you start charging it.)  (It gets hot when the ext battery is being charged or when it's charging the iPhone.)Note that when the USB is used to charge the battery, you can charge it without attaching it to the iPhone.  However, when you are charging the external battery, it will not charge the iphone (because that would make it discharge at the same time it's being charged.)  That said, even with the USB plugged in, and the external battery full, the USB doesn't charge the iPhone. (Even though the user manual says it will charge both in sequence, it doesn't.) I am guessing it's only in wireless charging mode.So, after you unplug the USB from the external battery and press the back button, it will begin to charge the iPhone.Once it starts charging the iPHone, the process is just like plugging into an AC source except there's no cable.  It charges quite fast.A full ext battery can allow charging the iPHone about 1.3 times full capacity, if the iPhone is down to about 20%.Physically, the battery has 3 prong/hook latches onto the case.  But I fear the latch will break easily in the event of a drop.I dropped the phone in case, without ext battery, from bed to floor.  The bottom plugged in section almost came off and the top portion of the case slid out of location as well.  The design really is not fall proof.The plugged in port worries me the most.  In a fall, I fear the USB will be broken off and be left inside the charge port or worse yet, damage the port completely render the iPhone useless once you are out of power.Also, is it a good idea to keep the port constantly plugged in?  Wouldn't it cause unnecessary rubbing against the contacts inside and maybe render the contact less sensitive?With the elongated section plugged in, the case becomes longer.  Looks weird at first but I got use to it.When the bottom portion is plugged in, you will have a hard time with most headphone plugs because of the gap it made.  The factory iPhone headphone can still work because of the linear design of the plug.  My other 90" right angle plug Bose headphone will not work.There are many issues that are not "user friendly" with this overall design.It seems the designer is more eager to come up with a wireless charger than a fully integrated user experience.I reserve my recommendations on this product.****add after 2 weeks of useThe protection on this case is terrible.The case was dropped once from bed high and once from kitchen counter height.The first time it fell from the bed, it broke half of the slim piece next to the volume control buttons.When it fell from the kitchen counter to vinyl flooring, the top corners broke off.I have never seen a cover with such weak drop protection.The phone itself withstood much impact without the case.I fear this case won't be in working condition much longer.DO NOT BUY if you need batter refill as much as protection.
summary: Some issues you can't ignore...(added,, after 2 weeks of use)

The problem with this product isn't the build because as far as I'm concerned, it's a great case and it does exactly what it says it does. The case doubles as both protection for your iPhone 4 and as a credit card holder. It holds up to three cards which you can thumb out one by one from the small slot in the back. The cards hold in place thanks to a raised rubber bump inside the slot that keeps them secure. You really can throw your worries about the cards accidentally slipping out aside because like I said, the case does its job and does it very well. I also really like the black and gray mix design and though I was initially put off by the slight bulkiness the case adds to the phone, I feel like it gives the phone a heftier feel that somehow makes it seem sturdier and more comfortable to hold.The problem I have with this phone case is the idea of the whole thing. While it does work, you have to ask yourself if you really want to put a bunch of your most valuable possessions together in one convenient package. I absolutely hate the idea of losing my phone or my credit/ ATM cards but walking around with the cards slotted into the case managed to keep me paranoid for the entire time I had them together. Have you ever misplaced your phone? Of course, we all have. Now picture misplacing your phone along with your ATM card and now you start to see what I mean. And if someone steals your phone, which does happen in this day and age, you're also paying for a shopping spree.I actually like the case enough to recommend it but not enough to use it for card storage. I currently use it to hold my entrance keycard for work and the two together make a perfect fit, better than any retractable string belt loop chain or spring clip could ever be. As long as I remember to bring my phone, I won't be forgetting my keycard and I truly love the feeling.Again, the case works, I just think you have to have be absolutely confident that you won't lose it or just a reckless spirit.

I do not smoke and thus have no need for a cigarette lighter in my car.  I do, however, travel with iPads, iPhones, iPads, Kindle Fire and other USB-powered devices.  This unit provides two high-output USB ports for your vehicle via the cigarette lighter outlet.  It is high wattage which means that it will charge an iPad satisfactorily.  I am getting good use out of this unit.  It unobtrusively fits into the otherwise unused lighter outlet and provides real utility.  Recommended.  RJB.

reviewText: 5 stars because it does a great job for it size when used with 4.65" screen of Galaxy Nexus.  The phone just needed a bigger batter compartment to start with, but for its job, a good battery.

I use the one year service on my tracfone.  I like to have an extra phone to use for emergencies and the tracfone service is perfect.  It is cheap and so easy to add to the phone.  The seller was excellent, I ordered the one year service card on Sunday and it was delivered the next Wednesday.  Very simple to add the airtime to my phone, just type in the 15 digit number, press ok and within seconds the minutes have been added to the phone.  Also, any minutes that the phone has left over are added to the new minutes.  Love it!!  Couldn't be easier.

Think the Otterbox Commuter: two pieces, one very shock-resistant rubber that protects the corners from drops, and the screen from when you put the phone down, blocks dust from ports with flaps over the ports, etc. and a hard snap case over that, keeping it in place and preventing the soft rubber from getting loose, strong and sturdy.But then take away the Commuter's backside that is far too slick and easy to slide out of your hand and drop, and put in a little exposed circle of soft rubber that provides a surprisingly great grip. Then take away the Commuter's impossible iron-hard buttons and replace them with soft, rubber caps that are very responsive and much, much easier than the Commuter's. The response is even better than if you didn't use a case. The port covers don't really get loose, but time may prove me wrong (I've had it for like a month now), but it seems legit.The only complaint is the screen protector... (FYI it's not matte it's clear)It has that rainbow effect where it shows an oily surface-type thing that basically look like your phone is greasy, 24-7. I didn't care for it, so I put back an old screen protector I bought a while back. Don't apply the one that comes with it; if you have one on keep it on.All in all, good case. Better than the Commuter, but watch the screen protector.
summary: Like the Otterbox Commuter - but better!

reviewText: Bought to hold my Thunderbolt in a pickup.  I have it suctioned to a beanbag type mount.  All in all it does the job of holding the cell phone in a way that I can see it as I'm using the cell for navigation with this.  I found that the legs (you get 4 short ones as in the photo and 2 longer ones for large phones (like the Thunderbolt) do not fit very tightly in their slots.  The good part is that you can move the legs left and right so they don't affect any buttons.  The bad part is that if you don't have a phone in the holder, the legs just fall out.  I put small pieces of tape on the connection part of the legs to wedge them in and that seems to help.  It has held my phone securely while driving over some fairly rough roads and expanded large enough to hold the Thunderbolt while in a case.

The film goes on ok but the 'number 2' sticker that is to be taken off last doesn't come off clean.  It leaves a terrible backing/film on the transparency that even alcohol won't take off.  It will probably wear off in time.  Price is right but it does seem you get what you pay for!I suggest an alternative product if you can find one.  I won't order from these folks again.

I originally bought this case as a stop-gap while I waited for my speck case, since this case was prime eligible and relatively cheap. The speck costs 30 bucks. When I did receive the speck, I tried it on and ended up returning it. Compared to this case, the speck made the phone look too bulky.Pros:1. Nice matte finish. Not a fingerprint/lint magnet2. Good grip. Though the Droid Maxx has a rubbery texture of its own, it feels more secure in my hand with the case on rather than without. I think it could be because the glass of the screen reaches the very edges of the device and that makes it less grippy.3. No frills simple design, which I like.4. There are ridges at the edges of the case that give the phone a very slim look. The speck did not have any and it instantly made the phone look super bulky5. Decent protection. The phone has tumbled from my hand onto our hard wood floor about 4 times so far. No harm done.Cons:1. The case was slightly bowing out on one side away from the phone. Very slight but noticeable. After 2 weeks of use, this has significantly reduced and I can barely notice it anymore.2. The cut-outs in the back are not perfectly centered around the mic holes, leaving the mic holes at the edge of the cutout. I need to do more testing to determine if this is affecting calls. I have had people reporting trouble hearing me when I am on speakerphone, but I haven't yet concluded that this is due to the case.3. I wish the bottom lip of the case was deeper so as to come up to the bottom edge of the glass. The sliver of grey between the bottom lip and the glass looks odd. Given the flexibility of the case, I don't think a deeper bottom lip would make the case any more difficult to get onto the phone, as long as you insert the phone in bottom first.4. Only available in black and pink glitter at this time. I wish there was a deep sea blue version.Overall, definitely recommend.
summary: Fantastic case for the new Droid Maxx

I've tried several of these cell phone signal boosters over the last couple years, including the zBoost YX300, zBoost YX400 and the Wilson Electronics 801242 MobilePro.  None of them really do all that much, and all of them are grossly overpriced, given the absolute minimal improvement they offer.  With such little bang for the buck, it's hard for me to say it's worth anyone's time, trouble or money to get one of these.  Having said that, if you're in an area that gets terrible cell reception, then you may as well give one of these a try and see if it helps -- just be sure to buy direct from Amazon so you can return it, no questions asked, if you're not happy with the results.Ridiculously Short Antenna CableIs coax cable really that expensive by the foot wholesale?  Because given how many manufacturers scrimp with short cables, you'd think it's more precious than gold.  It's just stupid, plain and simple.  The instructions for virtually all boosters like this are emphatic about keeping the antenna as far away from the base unit as possible, yet, they give nowhere near enough cable length to accomplish that requirement.  This is especially ridiculous for car boosters, since, given the cable length, the only option is to run the antenna out the nearest window and stick it to the roof of the car.  Clearly they're hoping everyone who wants to do a decent clean install will come running back for pricey extension cables -- the slight of hand couldn't be more obvious; it's blatant nickel & dime price gouging.Does It Really Boost Signal Strength?Eh... sort of.  My cell phone basically gains 1 bar of signal strength no matter which of these signal boosters I use -- hardly enough to justify the steep cost.  In fact, if you're not militant about the antenna placement, these boosters often don't work at all, and can cause a feedback loop -- It's happened to me many a time where the caller and I were hearing an echo delay, which magically disappeared once the booster was turned off.  So yes, these can help -- sometimes, maybe -- but they can just as easily become the root of your signal problem too.Nice Phone CradleI do like the design of the phone cradle itself.  The side grips are adjustable up and down, as well as with adjustable width to fit any phone.  My phone is held firmly in place without any concern over being too tight to cause any damage, or making it difficult take the phone in and out.  However, I could also see my phone easily flying across the car if I had to slam on the brakes; it could easily pop out of this holder by accident, no problem.Gooseneck Power AdapterThis one is going to be 'love it or hate it' depending on how your car is laid out.  For me, the cigarette lighter/power adapter is in a spot that makes using this gooseneck mount inconvenient, because it places the phone directly in the way of the gear shift.  Also, the part that inserts into the car's accessory slot is such a tight fit, that I was afraid of damaging the car when trying to remove this goose mount. It was VERY difficult to get out and back in again multiple times while trying to adjust the fit.  If I decide to keep using this, I'll probably opt for mounting it directly to the dash somehow and just toss out the gooseneck.Alternate Power OptionsThis booster can alternatively be powered by a standard USB/micro cord that can be plugged into a standard cigarette/accessory adapter.  One saving grace is this holder DOES have a charging port to charge your cell phone.  Now that's a nice touch.Bottom Line - If you're getting terrible cell reception, then you may as well give one of these boosters a try.  In my opinion, it doesn't matter which one you get, because they're all solidly mediocre and overpriced.  Just be sure to buy from Amazon, or somewhere that has an equally good return policy, just in case.  Good Luck!
summary: Meh - The Cost Isn't Worth The Marginal Boost

If you are thinking of purchasing a Bluetooth speakerphone for use in your vehicle, you should consider getting this device from Motorola.  This device is easy to use and makes use of what is now the standard power connection that is used by most mobile handset manufacturers.  In other words, you don't have to carry around many different car chargers for different devices.  Also, you can use your cell phone's charger to charge this device at home and don't have to deal with charging the device while driving.  In addition, this device has a pretty long battery life, which allows you to talk for many hours in between charges.This device also allows you to pair two phones.  To me, the more important use for this feature is that I can drive my wife's car and use this device as a Bluetooth speakerphone without having to deal with setting up anything.  An alternative use for being able to pair two phones is that you can have both phones paired simultaneously and both can use the speakerphone when taking or making calls while in the car.  I'm not sure whether the one not driving will benefit much from this, but it's one feature worth noting.

Great product for your IPHONE 5! The item comes in as described and protects my phone perfectly well. I love the color. If it wasn't for this Otterbox Case, I would be looking into buying another phone because I have dropped my phone several times and this item protects your phone!

It seems to not come apart so easily, as in previous versions.  I work in a bakery/kitchen setting, and this takes a beating and comes out shining.

The only negative is that I am unsure if it would help much on a far drop, but for everyday scuffs and bumps it feels and looks good, and the kickstand piece is amazingly useful and very solid feeling.

This OXA external battery charging device comes with a keychain attachment and a USB cord with multiple adapters (so you can connect it to virtually any type of phone or tablet that you need to charge). You recharge this device by connecting it to a computer USB port or a USB port on a vehicle or AC outlet. It has an indicator light showing you when it is charging, though it doesn't show the progress before it has finished. This device is 2600mAh - not the greatest capacity but sufficient for most users. It charged easily and has worked fine with the devices I have tried it with. It has a very poorly translated instruction sheet, but since it isn't complicated to use that isn't such a big issue. This is currently reasonably priced on Amazon, and these are great to have for portable charging. If you know anyone who often has their phone or tablet battery run down when they don't have an outlet nearby to recharge, this may be an ideal gift for them.
summary: Inexpensive small backup battery charger for mobile devices

I was influenced to go Android based on dodgy BB experience and very knowledgable friends sharing their experience. I have been very happy with the experience so far. May it live long!  For this device specifically, I have been quite happy with the ease of use, nice build quality, solid feel, decent screen size and relatively good battery life. I also quite like the Motoblur interface, but not necessarily all of the AT&T; preloaded apps which I can't use on my network.That said, in the two weeks which I have been using the phone, I have had it lock up completely once. Also takes long to load contact list, which is a pain when in a hurry, or on the go. Screen sensitivity varies greatly, and not just the usual night vs. day variance I have found with most touchscreens, and have had the auto-rotation not work for a brief spell.  Also have experienced some "ghost taps" on the virtual keyboard in very bright sunlight. All minor glitches which cleared up quickly enough, but I expected a bit more or less of it. I also would love the phone to have a cover on the mini-USB port to keep out the dust build up.Overall a good phone, with great call quality and functionality.

reviewText: I've had so-so experiences with BT headsets before, so I was skeptical about this one. But I shouldn't have been.Positives:1 - It is smaller than I expected, and lighter. It's like the length of two dice stacked on each other.2 - It feels nice and looks nice. I have a full beard, and my wife says it almost blends in. Now I don't have a blue beard, but I guess in lower light it is all just dark. :)3 - Their Web site and software works flawlessly. It was easy to just plug in and update. I am on a Mac, and it installed smoothly and just works. I was happy to see that you can change the press and hold to launch Siri. I did that, and it works great.4 - Wife called while I was in the car, and she said she could hear me quite well, certainly better than my stereo's built-in mic.5 - That brings me to the delight. I was worried about how this would do in my car, because I have a BT radio (Sony MEX-BT3900U). I want to stream my music/books to my stereo, but use the earpiece to handle calls. So as I mentioned, I was in the car listening to my Audible audiobook, and my wife called. It paused the book (as usual), showed caller info on my radio (as usual) and also told me about the call in my ear. I pressed the button on the headset to answer, it answered it on my earpiece. I got done with the call, and pressed play to resume on my radio, and it started streaming back over it. Seamless! Also, on the way home, I got out of the car, and it paused the book (as usual), but I pressed play, and it resumed on my earpiece.6 - I am able to pair it both with my iPad mini and my iPhone; it works great with both to stream audio.7 - No problems with my beard obscuring my voice, it seems. Still, the real test will be when I have the top down; too cold for that right now..8 - I got it at least partly so I could have an easy and convenient way to listen to audio on my devices while, e.g., watching a show on TV or lying in bed, without disturbing those around me. It works well for that.9 - Stays on decently even without ear loop, probably not for jogging, though.Some drawbacks:1 - As far as I can tell, it doesn't support pause/play for media; inconvenient when your phone is in your pocket.2 - Volume control is a bit odd--press and hold and wait while it cycles. There is enough room they could have made it a rocker and click, similar to the Apple earbud controllers.3 - Sound quality isn't awesome, but it is sufficient.

Whether or not you're concerned over the possible effects of your cell phone's radiation on your brainwaves, the Echo Logico handset provides retro charm with state-of-the-art functionality.The soft-touch receiver (we got basic black) has a comfortable grip yet also has a nice weight to it (unlike some flimsier handsets) and the 3.5 mm jack fit snugly in our iPhone.  There's no volume adjustment on the actual handset, but there was no problem either hearing or being heard.  It does have an easy-to-access, on-deck hang-up/pick-up button and a coil cord that's long but not too long.And, for those concerned about potential smart phone hazards to your health, the Echo Logico claims to reduce mobile phone radiation by over 99%.  We just think it looks and feels cool.

I have a couple of the anker slimtalk 3200 mah and love them. So for a bigger portable pattery, I stuck with Anker again, and it didn't dissapoint.The size of this battery will be a little big compared to the portable slimtalks, but its expected for a 10kmah. The size and feel of it is perfect though. It is not too heavy, and fits in a pocket if you need it too. Definitely light enough to not be noticeable much in a backpack, where I plan to keep this. For pocketability and portability (and more short term use) I suggest the Slimtalk. The Astro3E will be for my big weekend trips and travelling, where I will have a pack anyways.I put it to the test this past weekend on a weekend snowboarding trip for just my cell phone (droid bionic) and I was not even able to drain it completely. Did not plug my phone into a normal charger the whole weekend, and even had a friend charge his iphone on the trip back.It charges my Nexus 7 just fine as well, which requires the higher amperage. Also tried an Ipad 4th generation, and worked fine.Don't leave home without one of these. I used to carry spare batteries, but how often I change my cellphone and also multiple devices that charge by USB (gopro, bluetooth headphones, tablet, etc) this covers everything I have now and in the future. I never have to go find an outlet at an airport anymore, or rely on riding busses that have outlets, and can live worry free about having juice for my cellphone.

It's a nice cases.  It little bit too thick to be considered "slim" but it should offer good protection.  I've been carrying my naked phone around for the past few days so this might take some adjustment.  It does make me feel better to have some protection through.
