As an owner of the LTE Galaxy Nexus I was extremely disappointed with the OEM Car Mount available from Samsung and Verizon and went on the hunt for another in-car mounting solution.I am so happy that I stumbled across this product. The construction is very sturdy; the operation, simple; and the mounting solution elegantly ingenious.The design allows for quick insertion and release from the dock. Press one button and the arms pop open, then close in a balanced manner (both arms move the same distance when closing) insuring that your phone will be centered on the dock. Soft foam supports on the sides allow you tightly grip the phone (mine fits easily with a hard-shell case left on) without putting undue stress on the phone or support arms, and the space in the arms and the bottom support are great for cable management.If you don't have access to a true "Dock" for your device (one that triggers a Car Mode), I could not recommend this mount more!

reviewText: This FRIEQ Universal Waterproof Case for electronics is basically a thick vinyl pouch with plastic bars at the top that secure with two ridged thumb clamps. At the top is a hole to attach the included detachable lanyard so it can be worn around the neck. In back is a loop for the included soft, hook & loop armband or even to go through the strap on a backpack. Under that loop is a jack for headphones or to connect to waterproof speakers and inside the pouch is a male plug that goes into the jack on the cell phone or MP3 player.Most importantly, this case is truly waterproof. It seals tightly enough that I can't squeeze air out of it when it's inflated and when tested in the sink underwater, not one drop gets in. This makes it perfect for outdoor activities at the pool or beach or even for hiking in the rain. The size is generous with the pouch roughly 4 in. x 6 1/2 in. so that it will hold all standard cell phones plus keys, money, and credit cards.I had looked at hard waterproof cases before and have used Aloksaks but this is what I have really needed because it is lightweight but durable, seals tightly and securely, and has the headphone jack. I am starting to get excited about summer being just around the corner so I can spend a day at the beach and this waterproof case is already in my beach bag, ready to go! It's going to be just as useful for protecting my iPod from sand as from water.It's also worth mentioning that it has the goofy little three-eyed FRIEQ monster on the bar at top!A sample was provided for unbiased review.
summary: Truly waterproof and has a jack

reviewText: I purchased this directly from Seido, and it's dieing on me repeatedly. If it ever works right (I pray it does, as I bought the Extended Case as well) I'll update my review/rating accordingly.As for it's look, I like it better w/the battery/case combo, as it sits better in the hand for calls, and the device now is able to sit on it's side for watching YouTube vids. Adds a little stand to the back of the phone,.........sweet.Like I've stated, I really hope the battery starts to hold a charge, I really need this thing.UPDATE: Download a widget called "Battery Left" (Thanks to Clay Kelley) and recalibrate the battery by draining and recharging the battery a few times. This should allow the Droid's firmware to recognize the higher capacity battery installed. I've increased my rating to 4 stars so far, as the current (past???) issue of having to turnthe phone onand off is a real PITA. If this works, that will be a DOA issue, and I'll go to 5 stars.

Phones, tablets, and many other devices are charged by USB, but your computer’s USB ports don’t provide sufficient power. This I why devices like the iClever Dual USB Wall Charger are necessary.▶ Package Contents• iClever Dual USB Wall Charger• User Manual• Warranty Card▶ Specifications• Input: AC100-240V 50/60Hz 500mA• Output: DC 5V 2.1A & 5V 1A• Size: 50 * 40 * 20mm• Weight: 70g▶ HardwareAs said in the specifications, the device is fairly small (2” x 1.5” x 0.8” inches; 70g), which is the product’s major selling point; portable for traveling. This product comes in white or black, with two USB ports on the front (2.1A and 1A), iClever logo on the size, and a retractable plug in the back. This makes the product compatible with both phones, and small devices, to tablets, and larger devices. Overall, the build quality of the product feels good, despite its $10.99 pricetag.▶ TestingI tested this product with my Nexus 7 (2013), running Android 4.4.4, using absolutely no other apps but system apps. By charging my Nexus device, I am able to find the charge rate.Time – Nexus 7 charge %8:13PM – 32%9:00PM – 51%10:00PM – 75%11:16PM – 100%Total Time = 3 hours 3 minutes (3.05h)Nexus 7 Battery Size x Amount Charged = Total Charge3950mA * (0.68) = 2686mATotal Charge / Time (hours) = Charge per Hour2686mAh/3.05h = 880mA per hourThis charges my device at 880mA per hour, which is 280mA more per hour than average. These are above average results from this charger for my Nexus device.▶ Final ThoughtsThis device charges above average and is small, which makes this the perfect travel device for your electronics. I would recommend this product and give it a 5 star rating.Pros:+ Portable and simplistic design, capable of charging at above average results (280mA above average)+ Able to charge both tablets and phones.Cons:I have no cons for this device.I was provided a sample in exchange for a thorough and honest review.
summary: The perfect travel charger, which tested to charge above average.

reviewText: Fits my Samsung note 3 like a glove. I like that it is clear so you can see they phone through it. Very strong and durable. I have had mine now for a couple of months and I am very pleased with it. Great price!

This mount is very sturdy, easily customizable, has an INCREDIBLY strong suction cup, and it fits my somewhat large Nokia Lumia 925 very easily. In about two months I haven't had any problems with it falling off or losing suction.The one problem I did have was that it caused some damage to my dashboard in my brand new Subaru Impreza. The mount did stick very well to the dash (other reviewers reported problems) and I left it in place for about a week to test the position. When I decided I didn't like the placement, I moved the mount to the windshield but unfortunately it left behind a ring of compressed dashboard rubber which isn't residue or sticky but is pretty upsetting. I was hoping that with time the rubber might spring back to look like the rest of the dash but it seems that the ring is there to stay. The dashboard in the Impreza is a sort of rubbery non-slip surface, and where the mount was attached the rubber is now less grippy and shinier than the rest. I know it could be worse and it is purely cosmetic damage, but I am sad that a $20 mount has caused this kind of damage to a brand new $20,000 car. I have uploaded a customer image.The mount is a good product, but I will be using it only on the windshield from now on. The ring continues to haunt me.
summary: A great mount, but might cause dashboard damage

The outside is a textured plastic shell which feels somewhat "soft" but not rubbery. If you keep your phone in your pocket, this is great because there is no sticky rubber to catch on anything. This was a huge problem for me with the "bodyglove" case I had before. The look is cool too. It looks and feels very high quality (almost like leather), much better than any of the other cases for the Droid I have seen so far.The inside is all soft rubber; the thing I like about this is that there is nothing that can scratch your phone on the inside. All connections between the case and your phone are soft. Both pieces fit snugly and securely to the phone.There are rubber stoppers that cover all ports on the case. If you don't like these, you can easily and cleaning sever them with a knife. I really like the rubber covers on the power, volume and camera controls, as it actually makes them easier to use than with just the phone by itself anyway.It comes with a screen protection, but really these are superfluous anyway. The Droid already has a real glass screen. Real glass is not like the plastic on most cell phones; it is very difficult to scratch. You could take steel wool to a glass screen and not leave a single scratch.This is definitely the best case I have used so far on any phone. reviewText: PROS:Easy to useComes fully chargedAble to be rechargedCONS:Did not work for meAble to power my car radio, but couldn't power the starter motorDoes not work if the car battery is truly deadEven if it works, it takes 10 to 20 minutes to charge the carSUMMARY:Skip this device.If you want to spend around $20, invest in a good set of jump cables.  If you want a real car-starter battery, you'll need to spend >$50 and buy a real battery pack with those large alligator clamps that hooks up to your car battery.THE REVIEW:The Jump Up Emergency Car Starter is a simple device that supposedly will jump start your car by connecting through your cigarette lighter. This may sound intriguing in concept, but in practice it just doesn't work if your battery is truly wound down.The device is a simple battery pack with a plug coming out of it that fits into the cigarette lighter.  When the switch is in the up position, the LED light goes on and the device powers up your car.  When the switch is in the down position, you can charge the Jump Up device while your car is running.All of this seems clever, but it just doesn't work in most cases.The first observation is that trying to power the car through batteries that connect through tiny wires doesn't allow for a lot of flow.  Voltage and current are two different things.  The battery has enough voltage to jump start your car, but it lacks enough current--or amperage--to do this effectively.The instructions tell you to plug in the battery and wait 10 minutes and try to start the car.  If that doesn't work, you need to wait another 10 minutes. Why 20 minutes to see if the thing works?  Because there is a tiny wire that connects the Jump Up battery to your cigarette lighter and some more tiny wires that connect your cigarette lighter to your car's battery.  No matter what the voltage of the Jump Up battery, the wires are too small to allow for quick flow of the electrons to charge your battery quickly or turn your starter motor.  Moreover, you are relying on the device to actually CHARGE your car battery.  With a standard jump, you actually just need to power up the car enough to allow you to trip the starter motor--you don't need to actually charge the car battery at all for a jump to work.  (Once your car is powered up, your alternator will generate power to charge the car battery.)If your battery is just on the cusp of dead (left the lights on while you spent a few hours in the mall), you might be okay.  But if your car battery is mostly dead (left the lights on overnight), you are probably out of luck.  There's not enough juice in this device to power up your battery enough to start the car.  And if the battery is truly dead, the Jump Up won't be able to transfer the charge to the battery such that the car battery can power your starter motor.If your car battery is mostly dead, all you are left with is enough power to effectively light up your car radio and even run it.  So if the kids are bored while you are waiting for AAA to jump start your car, the device may be effective for you.  Even so, you will still need something more powerful to get the job done correctly.In most cases, a reasonable set of standard jump cables would serve you better than this device.  If you really want to power up your car via an external battery, you'll have to invest in a much more expensive, larger battery--the ones with those big alligator clips that hook directly on to your car battery.It's possible that the Jump Up might help you in a pinch if your battery is only slightly dead, but it is unlikely to work in most cases.  I tried this device on my car--it failed.  The old standby jumper cables still worked wonders.It really would have been great if the Jump Up worked the way I wanted it to.  This is another one of those incredibly simple solutions that just doesn't work.  Sadly, I can't recommend this device.
summary: Underpowered emergency starter--won't work if your battery is truly dead

The 5 port charger is not only portable, but most importantly useful. Rather than having 5 bricks that occupy so many wall outlets that are not so easy to find, Anker's 5 port wall charger is able to simplify the need into one convenient, portable, and light device.With using the device for several days now, I find it to do exactly like it says. All 5 ports work when connected with its included AC adapter flawlessly and my devices (iPhones/Tablets/Etc.) charge up to their normal speed. Everything just works - you plug in and your device begins to charge. Seamlessness is a quality that is exceptional within this charger.Another benefit that comes from using this product is the less clutter of wires. Prior to owning this amazing Anker Wall charger, I had wires going from so many places that it just looked terrible. After owning this Anker product, I am now much cleaner and organized when it comes to the cables and wires that are associated with using this product.The Anker wall charger can be used at home, in the office, in class, or nearly anywhere with an electrical outlet. The Motorola 89556N Roadster 2 Universal Bluetooth In-Car Speakerphone is a great little device to reinforce safety while you drive. It is common knowledge that we SHOULD NOT answer our cell phones while driving but it is inevitable that no matter what the situation is, we tend to answer our cell phones while driving. I guess this would be true for majority of us the reason why a lot of us now buy bluetooth headsets. Having a headset planted in our ears increases awareness and minimizes distraction compared to holding the phone by hand or pushing it against your shoulders.The Motorola 89556N Roadster 2 Universal Bluetooth In-car Speakerphone reinforces the "safety measure" when you drive and talk on your cell phone. Set up for this bluetooth device was the typical plug & play. It did not take long for my phone to scan & pair with this device. It is ready to be used once it is paired. Placing it on the sun visor of you vehicle assures maximum performance since talking will come naturally and the projection of your voice will be frontal or facing the bluetooth device where the speaker is also located just below the control panel. The 2-watt speaker with noise and echo cancellation proved to be crisp and clear. The person I was talking to heard me precisely. No jitters or background noise of sorts. Everything I said was heard and comprehended by the other person on the phone. The controls are easy to reach, call function buttons and indicator lights are on the front of the device--volume control, mute button and the call answer/terminate button. No fumbling when you need to press a control button which is very convenient. The power button is on the side of the device allowing you to turn if off when not in use but with a stand by time of 3 weeks and a talk time of 20 hours, you may intentionally "forget" to turn it off. Comes with the ultra convenient car charger so you can charge and use it while on the go. With a little bit of manipulation on the controls, this device is also capable of voice prompts for basic functions like battery status, muting and unmuting the device and call status. This convenient speakerphone also comes with an FM transmitter so you can stream music from your device and can now be integrated with an android app that you can download to your phone to serve as a car finder. Very cool indeed!Overall, very impressed with this device. Highly recommend this to further enhance your safety when talking on your phone while driving although common sense dictates that if your attention span is short or you are easily distracted, better NOT answer the phone.
summary: Driving safety is reinforced with some added perks

reviewText: I was a little disappointed, and quite frankly annoyed, at the lack of larger workout / running armbands for non-iPhones that were available. However, this armband fits the bill for exactly what I was looking for.I have a Galaxy Nexus and there is plenty of space for it to fit with or without my Cruzer Lite TPU case. Personally, I prefer to remove the case to make for an easier fit, however those who like to keep their cases on should not have a problem, unless it is one of the more bulky Otterbox cases (Defender series etc).I feel comfortable running with it on, no slippage, it remains snug and the phone feels protected from sweat or light rain / drizzle. I place the phone in upside down (since the headphone jack is located on the bottom of the phone), which makes for easier viewing and use of the phone's screen while running, as it it right-side up when you left your arm to look at it.Also, there is a handy pocket for a key or cash.All in all - and since there are limited options available for larger phones - I would highly recommend this armband.
These are a must to protect the I phone screens.  They are inexpensive and shipped out fast.  They do not hinder any actions with the phone, and I suggest everyone purchase screen protectors.

Great fit and case for S4. Sleek and stylish! I dropped my S4 and the case broke. There was no damage to the phone but the case cracked at the point of impact. I really like this case and it's the best so far out of the 6 cases I purchased. I might end up buying this case again.

Love the color and feel, but I must say that it adds (or at least feels as if it adds) considerable weight to the phone.  Still, it's an excellent fit (not sure why some people had problems with that), and it's good looking, too.  I bought the red, which is a nice, deep, sophisticated red.  Bottom line, excellent case, especially for the money.  Four stars instead of five because of the weight.
summary: Excellent fit, good color, but a little heavy.

reviewText: I have a Tylt mobile charger that I love.  Their products are well designed and generally work well.  Sadly, I don't really love this phone holder.  I am not able to get the sticky suction to stick to my dashboard even though it appears to be practically identical to the iMagnet Cradle-less that sits right next to it.  Also, the cradle system doesn't seem to hold my phone as well as the iMagnet does.If you need to have an NFC compatible mount this may work for you, but if not, consider the iMagnet Cradle-less phone mount.

It was easy to put on and I'm telling you the volume is great. No more putting my ear next to my gadgets to hear my music. It's light weight and easy to bring with you. I like it and I think you will too. Very good product.

reviewText: I like this case for my Asus tablet. Wish I could love it. I previously had a Kindle tablet and had several different cases for it. This one doesn't feel quite as sturdy and sometimes the magnets don't want to hold if I've had the cover folded back reading.One thing it definitely needs is Velcro on the tab that folds in, to hold the tablet in. I tried to take a picture, with the tablet in the case and I had to re-adjust it several times to get the lens in line with the hole on the case. I do believe Velcro on the tab would help this!I do like that it has a stylus "loop" on the side (top) and comes with a stylus. All in all this isn't a bad case for the price!
summary: Kamor Case For Asus Memo Tablet

reviewText: I bought my LiveView when it was featured on DailySteals.com on 07/31/2012 for $15.  I knew not to expect much, but I figured in worst case scenario, I'd just be out $15.  As it turns out, I'm out $15.I'm running an AOKP (an ICS build) on an AT&T; Samsung Galaxy S2.  Before pairing the LiveView with my phone for the first time, I installed Sony's "LiveView Manager" app (because it was recommended) and Sony's "LiveView Application" app (since I knew it would be necessary).Pairing my phone with my LiveView was like pairing with any other Bluetooth device; had no problem connecting on my first attempt.  After pairing, the "LiveView Manager" app immediately recommended that I install the "LiveView Application" (even though I had already installed it).  After bypassing that, I launched the necessary "LiveView Application" and started generating events on my phone.  I never lost my connection -- even the application saw the LiveView -- but none of the events were pushed to my phone, even after forcing a Notification Refresh within the "LiveView Application".  The one and only feature that did work was was the LiveView's "Find Phone" feature, which just remotely triggers a beacon on my phone.I also installed Sony's official LiveView Camera add-on and several third-party LiveView add-ons too, but the LiveView application "Manage plug-ins" feature reports that there are "No plug-ins installed".

The OXA 30000 mAh battery is designed to charge your laptop, tablet or cell phone. For phone charging, let's get something straight - 30000 mAh is probably MASSIVE overkill and you are spending money for something that you can use, but there are less expensive options available. To be clear, an iPhone 5s is something along the lines of a 1500 mAh battery. If you had 100% efficiency in charging (you don't - it's the nature of battery charging of ANY kind, not just OXA), you would have TWENTY recharge cycles for your phone. Let that sink in. For some people, that would be 20 full days of recharges. That's just... insane. If you want this for your phone, I hope it's because you will be doing some crazy travel, say the African Savannah where power isn't readily available. Otherwise this is overkill.Where this battery is NOT overkill, and where you are likely to get a fair amount of use from it, is for laptop or tablet charging. For an iPad Air, which sports an 8000+ mAh battery, you could easily get three full charges from the OXA 30000 mAh behemoth. That's a lot of recharges for a lot of time you can spend on your iPad. The other place this battery comes into its own is charging your laptop. The 30000 mAh is generally less than one full laptop charge, but if you are spending time on a plane or other travel and trying to work, and you routinely go longer than your laptop's battery can handle, you might just find this OXA battery can eke out the last remaining of hours you are spending on the plane with an active and live laptop. It's a life saver in these situations.Included in the box are adapters to plug into your laptop. There is one for Lenovo, HP, Dell, Asus, Acer, Toshiba and Sony. If you have a Samsung laptop, there are adapters available and I believe you could get one at a local Radio Shack if needed. This means you have everything you need in the box (assuming you have one of the supported models) to charge your battery during your travels.If you just want to charge a phone, be sure you have a real need for something of this capacity given the price. If you have the need for charging a laptop or tablet, then this device will likely be within your short list of things to purchase. It works well, charges quickly (well, relatively) and offers a lot of usage.Highly recommended if you have the need.I received a free sample for review purposes from the manufacturer.

This is not an authentic SAMSUNG product.  It works, but it is a counterfeit.  I thought despite the reviews  I would be safe ordering this since it was 'Sold by Best Buy and Fulfilled by Amazon'.  Apparently this is not s...I feel this product should be reported and removed from the site.

Phone car chargers are convenient to have around, especially if you have a cell phone with a non-replaceable battery. The TYLT Band car charger has some nice features. I like the flat silicon cable, since it practically eliminates tangled cords. The TYLT Band charges my phone very quickly, and it has an extra USB port so you can charge another device simultaneously. The color, lime green, is even kind of cool.Here are some things I don't like. There's no light on the charger, so when you are using it in the dark you don't know for sure if it's charging unless you check your phone. The cord is relatively short. Not a huge deal, since you should not drive and talk, but it would be nice if the cord was a little longer.  The biggest negative for me, however, is the price. There are a number of less expensive car chargers available that will do the job. So while I like the extras like the additional USB port and the tangle-free design, the TYLT Band is pricey for a charger.

Awesome sellers! Awesome glass door. I did not like all of the negative reviews prior to purchasing however I received this back piece and it is flawless. Don't listen to the negative reviews they obviously weren't careful in putting it on their device. I've had mine on for about a month and it has not shattered.If you order this (it is glass) so take precautions while putting it on. Make sure it is on all the way before screwing the screws back in otherwise the screws won't go in easily and if you apply too much pressure in attempt to force them to go in the back glass could shatter or break.
summary: Great Back glass! Make sure you know what you're doing.
